text:
Best Middle Eastern Restaurant in town. This is the place to go and eat, the food is excellent the portion is good, The hot bread is out of this world. The most important thing is the food is always the same, Not like other restaurant some times it is good and other times no so good. 

Try the fattoush salad with chicken shawarma. Don't forget the garlic! 
and for some of you who likes spicy food, try the sujuk,it's my favorite. we will be back.

LOVE! LOVE! LOVE!
Like I posted on Facebook.. my new fav! 
Atmosphere, ((food)) & the people, will keep me coming back! Recommending to all my friends!
 #SooooGoood!
My favorite Mediterranean gem in the city. From food truck to restaurant, Tony the owner, is amazing& his food is top notch. He genuinely cares about his customers & the quality of food he serves.
We ordered the factory hummus, chicken kabobs, and a chicken gyro. Portions are large and the food was fantastic. Very flavorful.

The costumer service is very slow just one waiter and she is running between the costumers in the restaurant and delivery orders. The shawarma sandwich is not shawarma, it's steak sandwich. Anyone  who knows what Mediterranean food can recognize the good shawarma. The hummus and babaghanog are tasty but  they are too expensive compare to their plate size.

Great service they are very nice and polite. 
The food came out pretty quick. 
Very nice environment with upbeat music not to loud and clean. 
I had the chicken and filet kabob. Chicken had good flavor and was not chewy. The filet needed flavor and to be a bit less cooked. Not chewy which was good. 
The lentil soup was missing a bit more spices to flavor it. 

Overall I would definitely give it another try in the future.

So so good! Filet mignon and chicken skewers were AMAZING! Fresh pitas made right on the spot and served to the table warm. The hummus was fresh, flavorful and was perfect with the meat, veggies and pita. 
Their Greek salad was HUGE and probably had the. Eat flavor of any restaurant salad I've ever had... and I've had a lot of salads.
A beautiful restaurant with amazing food and excellent service.The zucchini fries were unbelievably delicious. I can't wait to go back.

Tried it after being open less than 2 wks. Was disappointed they didn't have their liquor license yet to enjoy a glass of wine with dinner.
Food was very flavorful. Decor and ambiance was great away from that front window area. Loved the Baba ganoush and never had to ask for more bread. The salad was great too but too large. Share one next time. The kibbe was not at all what I have had all of my life - very different flavor of herbs and somewhat dry. I'd try something else next time.
Service was way above average, especially in Las Vegas.

Excellent service and excellent food. The falafel sandwich was delicious as were the eggplant fries. I took a habanero hummus to go and shared it with coworkers. They all thought it was excellent also.
Great environment!!  Great service!!!  This restaurant is it Hidden Gem the service is amazing the food is delicious five stars two thumbs up I highly recommend!!!!!
One of the best Mediterranean cuisine, the jalapeño hummus is a must and the service is excellent, clean and comfortable

I tried Hummus Factory (on Sahara) today. Wow. I'm very impressed. I ordered the chicken skewers and a salad. The food tastes fresh and very flavorful. I will definitely return. I was serviced by George and Nicki and I had prompt service and they came by my table several times and were very professional. I even enjoyed the music playing. Great experience, and I am not one to post Yelp reviews.
Love this place for lunch or a quick drive by to pick up and bring food home after work.  The staff is friendly the food is good.  My favorite is the grilled chicken Greek salad and pita.

One of our favorite traditions is to try different Mediterranean restaurants when we travel. We were vacationing in Las Vegas and just had to try the Hummus Factory for dinner.  Our waitress was Tory T. She was very pleasant, helpful and gave us great service.  We ended up getting the Mini Mezza (because we just couldn't decide on just one entree) with Shabiet for dessert.  Everything was very fresh and tasty!.  Our only regret is that it is so far away that it will be a while before we can get back there to try more of their fantastic food!

The only suggestion we have is to add an appetizer of Kibbi - it would be a great choice for either of the Mezza plates.

The Factory Hummus was really good with fresh from the oven pita! Portions are huge so consider sharing. All the staff are extremely friendly. Atmosphere is relaxing and calm. Definitely going back to try more things on the menu.
Stopped in for lunch and had a gyro sandwich. It came with a heaping portion of fries. It was the best gyro I've had in a while. I'm definitely coming back here.

I enjoyed this great little restaurant yesterday for lunch.  The staff was great and the food was          A-M-A-Z-I-N-G...to say the least.  This restaurant is the product of previously being a food truck! So, I checked in and got the house factory hummus for free, it was delicious.  Then, I ordered the jalapeño hummus was good with a hit of jalapeño not spicy but very tasty...I like the original better!  Next I will try the habanero, scorpion, and ghost pepper hummus.  We ordered the Greek salad which can easily feed 4 people. It was fresh, tasty and definitely deserves a return trip.  We also ordered the veggie shawarma plate that was too much for to people, we left with leftovers.  I highly suggest ordering multiple items and share with a group. Throughout our visit there were a lot of people who order to go, so if you don't have the time, just call it in.  I WILL be going back to this great place.

This was my first time trying Mediterranean food with my wife, and I must say that I definitely believe they set the standard high for us. Everything had an amazing flavor. We ordered the lamb chops it came with six chops and a kabob with assorted vegetables. The chops we very zesty and juicy. Our server Nikki was very nice and offered great service would recommend to anyone anytime.

Went  today to try the food was thinking the restaurant is going to be wonderful the food came back over cooked and with a lot of lemon and the owner came and explained me that mediterranean  cuisine is with a lot of lemon ordered Coke and received Dr Pepper feeling unhealthy with a lot of heart Burn from the food Service people were nice no energy in the restaurant whatsoever I wish them the best of luck

THE Best Mediterranean with a twist food I have ever tasted! I mean do you think it's obsessive that we have eaten here 4 times with 1 time take away? Maybe that's not a lot to you, but I am talking 5 times in 3 weeks. shrimp scampi... the bomb, Greek fries delicious, vegetarian dolmades perfect little finger food! And the ghost pepper hummus, so good that I used the small amount that wasn't noshed, in a vinaigrette dressing for my salad the next day. The puffed up, fresh out of the oven pita... Ahh the smell is divine. Lebanese coffee and desserts sooo good, I have to plan my meal around making a little room for the goodies. All the food we have tried is exploding with flavor. 
The atmosphere is so chill I feel completely relaxed from the outside world. I think it's my new happy place! 
The staff is very sweet and the chef usually comes out and delivers food to the table, last time he hooked me up with perfectly sweetened Lebanese coffee.
Nothing is better than feeling the love and care in the food your eating.

I have been to The Hummus Factory twice since it opened.  The service is fantastic. The server (not sure what his name is) has a genuine smile and very polite. I always tip him very well because he works hard and truly deserves it.

Price range is pretty competitive with others in the city (example Paymon's). The decor is quite interesting as it doesn't read Mediterranean although it is very well kept and clean. I will say that my first visit during the summer almost killed me; the air conditioning either wasn't working or they just didn't turn it on to save on electricity. It was way too warm and I was sat way in the back of the restaurant by the back entrance when there was no one else in the restaurant.  The second time around it was still slightly warm but much cooler than the first time.  

The eggplant and zucchini fries are huge portions and are cut slightly too big for my taste. I think they would be crispier if they were cut slightly smaller. The portions are big and remind me of CheeseCake Factory sizes, very rare to find this in Mediterranean restaurants.  

Overall, I definitely recommend this place perhaps in the fall and winter when it's cooler unless they worked on the A/C system. The service is excellent, food is pretty consistent...Also, I happened to catch a wild Pickachu playing Pokemon Go in the restaurant as I waited for my food.  That itself is 2 stars alone!!!!!

My fave place to go for Mediterranean food. Friendly staff, all family. Best zucchini fries on the planet, kabobs and salads are all amazing. I love al, of their salads, so crispy and clean eating feeling. The hummus is so smooth and creamy, definitely one of the best. I go there almost once a week because I'm so addicted to their food. Love love love this place.
My daughter and I decided to try the Hummus Factory for lunch and absolutely loved it! The welcome, the service AND the food was amazing!
Every time I dine here or order for pick up I try something new from their Menu Everything here is so fresh, well seasoned and delicious. Definitely one of my favorite spots in Summerlin.

The restaurant might have been having a bad night, but I had to share tonight's experience. We have ordered take out from the restaurant before. We have always had a great meal and food leftover for snacking later on. But the portions must have been reduced since our last time we ordered take out. We ordered two gyro sandwiches and the jalapeño hummus. The major portion difference was the hummus. We received 1/3 of the normal portion, definitely not worth the 9 dollars. We might have to rethink where we get our Greek food in the future.
The hummus was great of course but the Greek burger and Greek fries cannot be overlooked.  Also tried the Greek salad my daughter ordered, delicious!  Can't wait to go back and try everything else.

My family is visiting from California, and are very happy that we found this restaurant for dinner tonight!  We enjoyed all our meals, especially the homemade bread and garlicky hummus, seasoned butter, salad, and gyro sandwich. Everything is very fresh, flavorful, and well-seasoned!  Our waitress Mimi and her mom Nicky were very friendly and attentive, they made our dining experience even more enjoyable. The atmosphere was very pleasant, too!

I cannot say one bad thing about this place. Ordered tons of food because my friend and I love to try everything and still have leftovers to enjoy later. The food is absolutely incredible! The service was really good as well. The waitress constantly refilled our drinks and brought us more pita bread without even asking. She was super kind and really made us enjoy our time there.

I went in an a weeknight at 6:15 and the place was empty... usually not a good sign.  The decor is not elaborate and I thought the prices were relatively high, but the food was awesome.  The pita bread was fresh baked and hot from the oven (not just taken from a bag and heated in an oven).  My personal favorites were the babaganouj and the sujuk; both overflowing with flavor.  Our server was the owner's mother, a charming lady, who made us feel very much at home.  I recommend this place highly.

Great food. 

I was impressed by the number of gluten free items. 
Personally loved the family recipe garlic chicken, hummus, kabobs and baba ganoush.

We will come back.  

Wife loves loves loves the house baked bread here.

It was suggested I try The Hummus Factory because they had great ratings and their food was good. I'm happy to say I wasn't let down, it does have good flavor and the portion sizes are large. It was easy to find they have a frontage location with plenty of parking. The moment I pulled up I said what a nice little place, upon waking in I was greeted with a smile and a hello welcome to hummus factory as she was serving a table. I think it's important to be acknowledged, especially when it's your first time in an establishment. The place is clean, friendly and fast service. 
We had the chicken kabobs served on rice, Greek salad, hummus and a gyro! All of it was really good food.

Their reputation precedes them with their food truck so I had to try it when they opened their restaurant at a former deli.  I've been to both dinner and lunch service, and was equally impressed with the food and service both times.

Pita bread is served pillowy and when punctured, it lets  out a puff of steam. Paired with the Factory Hummus,  it's even better.  The falafel appetizer is generously portioned and perfectly crisp. The veggies underneath offset the density that falafel can sometimes have. I had the beef schwarma sandwich. Once there was a tad too much tahini, but I scraped the excess away to make it better. The kafta is evenly seasoned and was mild enough for my son to eat too.

If I had to find fault with one thing, they plate so much vegetables - lettuce, cucumbers, etc. - on most of their dishes, that I feel like they could save some money giving a little less. I love my veggies, but i don't think their customers would notice or mind if they held back a little.

Our lunch waiter was extremely attentive but not hovering. Dinner was served by Niki (owner) and her daughter. Again, they were attentive and wonderful conversationalists. 

Can't say how great it is to have a family-owned restaurant to keep going back to in the neighborhood.

We heard great reviews about this restaurant. My wife had the chicken kabob and I had the filet of salmon. One of the best Mediterranean restaurants we've eaten at in Las Vegas. I would definitely recommend this.

Great place, great prices, family owned and operated, fantastic food! What more can you ask?! Walked in for first time and LOVED the decor, elegant country style that's very inviting. Was going to just grab some to-go hummus but had to sit and relax at the food bar just to take in the ambience. You can easily feel all the time and care that went into building the new Hummus Factory. Watched all the food come out from the open kitchen and the portions are huge with gorgeous plating and everything smells amazing. I know where I'll be taking my family for lunch next time! Congratulations on a beautiful restaurant and stunning menu! Eggplant fries, here I come! If you're looking for an affordable, restful place to get delicious, high-quality Mediterranean food, this is it. You won't be disappointed!

This is my 2nd visit to Hummus Factory. Excellent food, and great service. We were greeted by Niki, and Penny was our server. My girlfriend & I ordered salads with an appetizer of zucchini fries. Everything was delicious. My friend ordered falafel on her salad, which is not an option on the menu. Penny accepted the order then went to the kitchen to figure out a way to add falafel. Penny never mentioned it wasn't an option. Anything is possible right? That's the service you get here. Plus the food is amazing, enjoy!

This place does not disappoint. I have no idea why they are never busy when I'm here because it's so darn delicious. Their hummus is fantastic and I've tried a variety of kabobs,  all fantastic. Service is on point.

This place is amazing, best kafta plate i've ever had. The hummus and tabouli are fantastic, the restaurant has a bistro vibe, 10 out of 10......also make sure you are hungrey, the portions are hearty and filling!!!!

Trying new Lebanese cuisine in Las Vegas can't go wrong with this restaurant beginning with their hummus and bread I had the fatoosh salad omg the flavor! Their Kafta plate was also delicious everything was fresh and tasty
Great service and  lovely ambiance.

This place was delicious.  8 of us ate here and split everything, nothing disappointed.  All of it was delicious.  Jalapeño hummus was nice! Don't forget to ask for garlic spread!  Only complaint was the door chime, it sounded like a dying squeaky tool every time anyone opened the front door. What I would have given for a sledge hammer...

We have been waiting for this place to open and when it did we enjoyed every minute of being there. The costumer service was great. Not only did the food come out quickly, it was delicious! Hard to pick my favorite dish because it was all so yummy. Definitely get the hummus - duh! I will be going again soon!

I ordered carry out so I can't rate on table service but the whole carry out experience was wonderful. While placing my order I was informed of a new habanero hummus they had. I tried it and loved it!  Very spicy so if you're not into a lot of heat stay away. Also got a Greek salad. It was very large & fresh. The dressing had a hint of sweetness I could have done without but not a deal breaker. From phone to pickup everyone was very polite, informative,prompt & correct on entire order. On my list for a go back & dine in.

Amazing restaurant with amazing staff. Everyone was so nice and attentive. The portions were huge and filling. The pink sauce that comes with the fries is so good! Excellent food for the money! Definitely recommend!

I came to lunch here with a group of my colleagues. The restaurant wasn't super busy, so we were able to find a table right away. The owner, who is also the chef, came out and introduced himself. He suggested various items on the menu and served our food :). You can tell the owner is very hands on with his business and takes pride in his establishment.

The food was incredible! I absolutely loved the hummus and beef schwarma. The food was cooked perfectly and had just the right amount of flavor. Everything was so tasty, I've already planned another trip back. I can't wait for my husband to give it a try!

Omg, the service was amazing.  Quick to serve,  very friendly,  and food hot! ! They had both vegetarian and healthy food options in about a 50% portions which is great for both veggie and meat eaters!  My wife had the roasted chicken sandwich with the house made zucchini fries, she says by far the best she has ever had,   and I had the vegetable kabob with fatoosh salad,  freaking amazing! ! All and all,  we will definitely be back! ! Thank you for the awesome service and great food! !

We came in late very close to closing and the service was excellent! The hummus was amazingly delicious don't forget to order some! We ordered a bunch of appetizers and there was not a bad one in the bunch. The large salad could could easily feed 4 people with some appetizers. This is a great family owned restaurant.

This is my second review, and unfortunately I have to take down two stars because of my last visit...First I am going to start with the positive: The place is nicely decorated, with a friendly atmosphere and good music. The food choices are wider than most Lebanese restaurants, offering more than the traditional menu offered everywhere. The quality is good and close to authentic, but since my previous visit, I had to change my opinion a little: 
First, after a long wait, I received my order first; I thought the other two are on the way. As a courtesy, I decided to wait for my friend's food to arrive. By the time it arrived (20 mns later!), my food was cold and I could not enjoy it. Not only that, but I ordered the Beef Shawarma, and to my shock, I see what looked like thin slices of steak, instead of shredded beef as it is traditionally (and the ONLY way) served. When I tried it, it did not even taste like shawarma; the spices were not even close to the real thing. I have to say I was very disappointed, especially that I had a good experience on my previous visit, and the owner/chef is Lebanese so there is no excuse for not knowing the proper way to serve shawarma as it is one of our iconic dishes. My friend who also ordered and loved the Soujouk last time ordered it again but this time it was not the same...I did not want to give a bad review because I know they will fix this, and the place, being new probably is still tweaking everything like any new business, Hopefully they will work on how to serve the shawarma properly if they want to claim to have authentic Lebanese cuisine. It would have been the right thing also to offer not to charge my order since both waitresses were aware that I could not enjoy my food being cold; I did not want to make a big deal of it, but any respectable restaurant would offer at least that or some alternative...
Also I read from another review that they take too long to bring the bread and the owner's answer was that it is because it is served fresh to order. In my opinion, the bread's freshness should not affect the service or quality of the food, so unless they can maintain the same quality and handle the pressure of traffic (which I hope they will have), then you can serve regular pre-made bread until then. Most restaurants do that and nobody complains, because it it the food quality and service that counts at the end; the fresh baked bread should only be an added bonus, but not at the expense of important things, because people will not go just for the bread but the overall experience, in my humble opinion.
One last thing:  food should NEVER be served that far apart; most people will not start eating unless everyone is ready, so this is more of an etiquette issue than quality of food. I personally would have preferred to wait the extra 20 mns and enjoy my food WITH my friends than to stare at it then eat it cold...
Despite everything, I still love the place and wish the owner all the luck; like every new business, it takes time to make everything perfect. that's why there are good and bad reviews, because this is how you improve. The servers are very friendly and I know the food is too in general, so I will definitely go back there and hope that this was a one-time experience and look forward for my next visit. (But PLEASE do not serve the shawarma like slices of steak; it is the whole point of shawarma! :) ). 
Sorry for the long review, I did not want to present a negative one without giving the place the credit it deserves in other areas, I cannot wait to go again soon and give a much better rating!!

Nice halal place in Vegas away from the strip. I called ahead of time to confirm they were halal. It was about a 28-minute drive to get here from the Monte Carlo on a Friday Night but it was worth it. Their portions are really generous. I had to try the eggplant fries- it was good. The pink sauce that went with it made it even better. But I prefer my eggplant to be soft and slimy instead of firm and crispy. So I wouldn't get it again. The sliders were really good and had good flavor. Good luck trying to finish all three. They were huge and more like "mini-burgers". Their desserts were really good too and not too sweet. 

I love all the various halal options and the restroom was very clean. Will definitely visit again.
great greek food place and awesome service. only weird thing is the area of town, other than that, the homemade bread is amazing!!!

Stumbled upon this gem randomly and it ended up really really good. Seems like they started as a food truck but now they have their own spot and it's wonderful.

We got the eggplant fries and now we wish we had gotten more! We also got their factory hummus. I eat a lot of hummus and this is definitely one to be considered if you haven't tried it yet. We also got their falafel sandwich and let's just say we will definitely be back soon. Like real soon.

My family went here for a graduation lunch. We had a group of 12 or 13 people but the servers were very accomdating. Service was fast and the food was delicious. Overall everyone had a positive experience and enjoyed our time there. We'll be back.

Looking for vegan AND gluten free? You have come to the right place! The food is amazing! The picture speaks for itself. So good we practically licked the plates. The food is PERFECTLY seasoned with herbs and spices on EVERY dish we tried. The tapas sampler gave us a taste of 6 different items. The hummus, dolmas, Greek salad, potato salad, falafels were delicious! I could eat the appetizer portion of the zucchini fries as my main course. Hey, veggies are good for me! The staff made our dining experience even more amazing. HIGHLY recommended!!!

All their food is homemade. It was amazing! Their half chicken takes a little time to make but is worth the wait. One of the best meals I have had ! The friendliest staff and very attentive ! They give big portions so no one leaves hungry. Very happy and will definitely be back soon !

Just had an early dinner there and it was truly awful.  We had the factory hummus with home made pita which was great. Everything else was grossly over seasoned.  We split a kabob combo meal of chicken and steak with a factory salad.  The salad would've been good had it not had a ton of thyme or some other herb, making it almost inedible.  The steak was overcooked and chicken was overwhelmingly seasoned with a mustard type seasoning.  The rice it was sitting on was also tart and terribly over seasoned.  We didn't finish our meals and no one inquired as to why when we said we wouldn't like a to go box.  I wanted to tell the server all this, but he didn't hang around long enough to even pull aside.
First time here and first time trying Mediterranean food.. absolutely loved it! The place was clean and the staff was very friendly. I will definitely be coming back with my family!

I love this place. It is m y go-to lunch spot when I need a break from work. I have also gotten food to go to eat at my desk. The food is delicious and I usually get two meals out of it given the amount of food they give you.

My go-to order is the shawarma plate. The chicken shawarma is delicious and I love the tahini sauce with it. Along with the rice and veggies, you get quite the meal out of it. Also, it comes with a side which I always get the fatoosh salad. Best salad on the planet! 

Even better is their pita bread. It is warm and delicious, but they can't make it fast enough. This is part of the reason I am giving them four stars as opposed to 5. Another reason is because of the service. They are very friendly, but they are FAR too busy to have only one waitress working during the lunch shift. I was bragging about this place to my co-workers and brought them in one day and the service was so slow and we were having to wave down the waitress for more drinks and pita bread. It was kind of embarrassing for me. 

I hope they hire extra staff and I will change my review to 5 stars!

Food was way to salty!!!
The pita bread is fresh and taste good-the hummus was pretty good. The only bad thing is the salt level of each dish after eating I was drinking water like crazy because of the dehydration

They began as a food truck and expanded to their first location and might I say it is very authentic and light. I ordered The Falafel burrito to go and I am very happy camper. Besides the fried zucchini fries that got super soggy due to the box,  This is a must try forsure!
Everything was absolutely delicious! From the lentil soup to the delicious chicken kabobs! Best hummus in the city

Best meal I've had in a while. The food is quality and seriously delicious! Our server was attentive and sweet. I recommend going and checking it out. You can't go wrong here. The menu had so many great things on it. I can't wait to go back and try something else!!!!

First time here, read a review in the Japanese newspaper.

Food is very good. Service was slow, only one server. The food makes it worthwhile

Yes and thank you for Lebanese coffee! So good. Ate so much of the yummy hummus appetizer that I couldn't even eat my actual lunch order. Guess I will be taking it home. Everything was wonderful. We got zucchini fries and they were terrific with a lovely sauce. Service was fast and friendly. Also they played hip fun music. I was dancing in my seat after that coffee

I would love to give this place a five star rating but I feel like a four star is a solid rating for this place. The food is very yummy and affordable. The zucchini fries were recommended to me and honestly they let me down just a little bit. They were kind of soggy and I wish they were more crispy. Besides that I would definitely come back.

The food here is just wonderful. I've been hooked from the first time dining at this restaurant since then I've brought friends and family to eat multiple times. I definitely  eat here at least once a week. Combo kabob plate their meat is so good anyone you choose and then the greek burger so great! Top it off the staff are super friendly and helpful.

Formerly a food truck, the Hummus Factory finally has a brick and mortar spot- conveniently located near several gyms for healthy pre- or post-workout eats! Don't worry though, their menu isn't all healthy stuff- but it IS all tasty.

Highly recommend their salads- start at $10, add on protein separately. Price seems steep til you realize the portion could feed a whole family. The Greek with Falafel was literally all I ate one day, fresh and packed with olives. Add a side of hummus and pita, which comes out piping hot from the oven. 

Went in another day for a chicken shawarma wrap- super moist with tons of tahini and grilled onions. For best results, upgrade to the eggplant fries, they're lightly battered and seasoned and frankly, life-changing. I dip them in straight Sriracha and dream of them. My guy loved the combination lunch plate(chicken and steak). The grilled onions on that are awesome too, and I like how they use a sauce and herbs in their rice to keep it from being the same generic white rice you get everywhere else in town. Meat and veggies were perfectly grilled.

Service is super friendly and treats you like a regular after just one visit. Food comes out fast and everything is super fresh. Next time, I'm having the shrimp scampi and Greek burger. And the feta app. Okay, so the whole menu probably.

TIP: Check in on the Yelp app for free hummus!
Great flavor.  Makes my mouth tingle.  Nice environment, good portions.

The Hummus Factory is phenomenal! Definitely lives up to its name, hummus is fresh and delicious. Great service, atmosphere and every dish is perfectly made. My new go-to Mediterranean restaurant whenever I'm in Vegas!

Very good service - fresh made pita very very good - hummus very good.  Slovakia was a bit charged and falafel was good - not great.

Will be back!!!

Delicious! Stopped in for some Mediterranean food and we were not disappointed. I recently moved here from New York and had seen this gem a few times but never ate there. Almost a year later and I finally popped in to have a bite to eat. Little did I know that I've been missing out on amazing food this whole time! I wish I had decided to eat here sooner. Portions are HUGE and worth every penny. The fries are amazing and I'm a french fry connoisseur. Everything was just wonderful and the service was terrific. We have been back several times since then because my husband is hooked on the lamb chops! I have to say that the kafta was quite delicious and I am hooked on the shawarma sandwiches.

I loved this place!!!! They have countless gluten free items which taste amazing! You really won't be disappointed. We ordered grape leaves as appetizers and a few of my friends loved them so much, they got them as dinner as well. I absolutely loved my Greek Salad! I will be back!

I've been four times in the last two weeks, 5 stars every time. This is my new favorite - best Mediterranean food in Las Vegas. The jalapeño hummus and factory salad are amazing. Split a salad and a kabob, so delicious! The service is amazing too!
Service was awesome...she is the step daughter of the owner and told us all about the restaurants history. Their jalapeno hummus is to die for!
I got the spinach salad. The dressing was like eating a mouth full of salt. The chicken was sub par. I would not recommend this place.

We were just driving around and the name caught our eyes! The smell from the outside was mouth watering! We sat and we're given hummus and herb butter and pita bread. I usually don't like hummus and this hummus was amazing, light and flavorful I wanted seconds! The herb butter went perfectly well with the fresh pita. I wasn't too hungry so I settled for the shrimp scampi appetizer. I thought it was going to be small but it was huge for an appetizer. I loved the flavors it was very zesty and it came with rice all for $9.95. The service was also as great as their food. We will be back to try their lunch specials!

Made the trek from the Eastside to try the Hummus Factory since I had heard great things about it and boy, did it deliver.

The service was great, restaurant was clean and cozy. We used the Yelp checkin offer for the free hummus and now I'll never look at my store bought Sabra hummus the same way again. This hummus was so smooth and creamy, I've been dreaming about it since my visit. The hummus was served up with warm pita bread, fresh from the oven, and a perfect accompaniment. I've never seen pita the way they present it here: puffed up. It was eye catching.

We also tried some of the traditional Lebanese fare from the entree menu: kafta, frarej, and dolmas. All were delicious, except maybe too citrusy from all the lemon they use in the cooking, especially in the frarej. It was hard to focus on any other flavors that might have been present because their was so much lemon. For dessert, we tried the shabiet and rice pudding. The shabiet was pretty good, but if you're thinking a bout the rice pudding, just be warned that it's prepared with rose water and if you're not used to floral tastes, it might be too strong for you.

Overall, I was impressed and would definitely dine here again in the future.

I have been working a lot lately so I don't get much time to go to a restaurant and have been trying to eat healthier but once in a while get a craving for something like a gyro. 

I ordered a gyro, with only tomatoes and meat to go. Fries are included. 

Pros:
*lady in front was friendly 
*white linen tablecloths 

Cons:
*bunch of stuff in front of cash register 
*was given a falafel with everything on it. good thing I checked before leaving parking lot
*in my already busy day, had to wait for 2 orders 
*have had better pitas and gyro meat
*don't prefer fries with added seasoning

There are at least 3 better Mediterranean restaurants in the Vegas area. Sadly, this one isn't on my return list.

Impressed...

For starters the music in this place is perfect and I wanted to hang around just to keep listening to it. It's funky with middle eastern touches and I dig it! 

The service was great and everyone was working as a team being very attentive. 

Now to the food ~ overall everything was delicious and fresh. For starters they bring out herb butter for your fresh pita and it's straight out of the oven. What a nice touch! Then the regular fries and zucchini fries were perfectly crunchy and the gyros come with very flavorful meat dripping in tzatziki sauce with fresh tomatoes, red onions and lettuce. We ate everything up! 

Decor is great and it's very clean. Next time I need to try the hummus because this place is called the hummus factory! We will definitely be back.

My boyfriend LOVES hummus so we knew we had to check this place out! Upon reading the great reviews, we decided to check it out on a Sunday (we didn't know it was closed and checked on google and Google said it was open) now, we live across town so we drove somewhat far and were bummed out to see that it was closed! Nevertheless, we really wanted to try it out so we decided to check it out on a Tuesday night. As soon as we walked in, we immediately loved the decor! The service was also very nice! She was very busy as she was the only one in front and had a few large tables, but still managed to keep checking on us! The food was DELICIOUS!! I mean everything was so good!! The portions were HUGE! All the food had great taste, my bf got the spinach salad and added chicken to it and it was so good! I had the chicken Shawarma with zucchini fries that was delicious, and we also ordered the factory hummus, which was so good as well! Definitely worth the long drive! We have decided that from now on, this will be our monthly (and I'm pretty sure many more times) dinner date for our anniversary! Also, the lemonade is freshly made and delicious! Not too sweet just how I like it.

Service is so friendly and the food is amazing! Menu has expanded from what Tony had on the food truck (same name) and the quality and flavor is superb! You will not leave here hungry as the serving portions are generous. 

If you are on this side of town and want something other than fast food, this is the place to try! Mediterranean food at its finest.
Yet another Mediterranean restaurant in a 2 block radius. Pitas good. Hand made. I liked the sampler

This place was so delicious, everything was very fresh. We had the hummus, greek salad, falafel's, and greek fries and everything was amazing. The staff was friendly and personable. Definitely will be going back here for lunch next time we are in Vegas! I wish there was a Chicago location
Lots of gluten free items!!  Very good and a nice relaxing atmosphere!  Everything is great portions and the restaurant is clean and very friendly staff!! Delicious!
Great customer service! My boyfriend and I got the chicken shawarma sandwich and it was so good. I will definitely be coming back.

Shared Labni Matoom, Kabob Combo (chicken and beef), and factory salad. Everything is so fresh and flavorful.The bread came out straight from the oven piping hot!  Perfect lunch for a sweltering hot Las Vegas afternoon. I will definitely go back and try other dishes on the menu.

This restaurant is one of my favorites! Their pita bread is the best I have ever had... it's fluffy, light, & super fresh! The hummus of course is to die for and they have all different types as well! 

The flavors here are exceptional, and I could eat there food on a daily basis. 


The staff is also super friendly, and the vibe and atmosphere there is top notch.

I can highly recommend the Hummas Factory.  Lebanese food had already been a longtime favorite of mine, mostly because I had a few Lebanese friends who's mothers would feed me ..I mean there was nothing better than homemade Lebanese..That is until I walked in to the Hummas Factory...Everything I've tried is mind blowing delicious .

We had the mezze platter and everything was excellent! Got the shrimp too and it was perfect and the rice so yummy. The food is so fresh and the flavors so bold and amazing! This is by far the best hummus I have had in Vegas. The prices are great too. Nice casual atmosphere and the place is absolutely spotless.

The food here is worth the wait.  Charming atmosphere. Looking out thru the restaurant towards the street you'd almost think you weren't in Vegas. 

Great place for a leisurely lunch so you can sit and savor the beautiful full flavors of the food.
Super tasty; and great service... will definitely be back.. some of the best of this cuisine I've had

Wow... is all I have to say. Came here for lunch today before class and my girlfriend and I were amazed. I had the beef and chicken kabob combo while she had the chicken shawarma. My combo was amazing. Came with rice, one beef kabob, one chicken kabob, onions, and side of hummus and pita. The hummus and pita were amazing! I love their herb butter with my pita. The kabobs were cooked well and had a nice amount of seasoning on it. All the herbs blended into a nice taste. The shawarma was good according to my girlfriend and it came with zucchini fries. GET THE ZUCCHINI FRIES!!! It just melts in your mouth. Hands down my favorite thing there now. 

As far as pricing it's within the $10-$18 price range and you get a good sized portion. Lunch and dinner prices differ so watch for that.

The lady who served us was very friendly and maintained amazing service the whole time. Wish we remembered her name, but she was a nice Asian lady. Overall this place was a good spot to eat and we will be back again for sure.

I was so happy when I saw this restaurant moving in the same shopping center as my work. It is now my go-to spot for lunch. So great to have a healthy and tasty option close by. I look forward to working my way through the menu. Everything has been amazing so far.

I love their lentil soup, I come back just for that. I've only dined here at lunch, it's not too busy, the girl who waits on me is so sweet. I've nothing but a nice time here and would recommend it to anyone.

Factory Hummus, zucchini Fries, gyros... yummmmmm! Nice location, quick service, the inside is calm. The pink sauce is Sriracha and mayo, good, but a little spicy for me. 
In general, this is an amazing place, the staff is really friendly!

YUMMY! This was our 1st time trying this restaurant and we were very impressed. Everything tasted fresh and had tons of flavor. We tried the jalapeño hummus, Greek salad, chicken kabob, and grape leaves. I'd recommend them all. But I wouldn't leave without the Greek salad. IT WAS AMAZING! Can't wait to go back!

The Skinny: generous portions but execution needs work with the entrées (3), service: great, very friendly (5), value : although the portion sizes are more than generous, the food good is just okay. Given the plethora of great Mediterranean restaurants in town, I give this one a pass.(3 starred review).

I feel bad about this review. I really wanted to like this place - the server and hostess are super nice and the ambience is clean and well kept. The problem rests with the execution of  the dishes. To be fair this place is supposed to be Mediterranean fusion so I don't now if the below comments are intentional or not.

We ordered the hummus (free with Yelp check in at time of review) which comes with freshly made pita bread, the chicken shawarma plate and the gyros sandwich plate with zucchini fries upgrade.

The hummus and pita are both good and a definite order if you go. The pita is lighter, fluffier version and served piping hot as it ought to be. The side salad that came with the chicken shawarma plate was very generous and fresh.

The entrées did not fare so well. Both proteins lacked caramelization. It was fairly obvious that the chicken shawarma was not roasted on a spit/oven in a traditional manner as it was pale and watery. I suppose it was like this when it was served seemingly sautéed with onions and tomatoes. Very strange and not what I expected when I order shawarma. 

The hub's gyros has the same problem with the meat lacking the roasted flavor. His sandwich also had huge hunks (not slices) of tomatoes in it which overwhelms the meat in the sandwich.  (Oddly all the tomatoes used in our dishes were cut the same way.)

Zucchini fries were cut in a haphazard fashion leading to inconsistencies in texture (some were soggy) and uneven breading. Not worth the upgrade.

Although the service was good, the execution of the food is not worth a return visit. That being said, if you were to visit this restaurant, try to go for lunch as their prices are a little better than for dinner. 3 starred review

This is one of the best Mediterranean restaurants I have ever been to. The food looks and tastes delicious. The place is clean and has great service, the servers are very tentative, and they make sure you enjoy your meal. I will be bringing my friends and family here. I was looking for a healthy place and found it while driving by. This place has lots of gluten free and vegetarian options. The hummus is amazing!!!

Nothing but good things to say about this place! Me & my coworker decided to stop by for our lunch break.. I got the Gyro & our server recommended the eggplant fries (which were amazing!) the customer service at this joint is absolutely over the top.. Long story short, if you are unsatisfied in any way possible, they go above and beyond to resolve it. I can't remember the name of the gentlemen that served us, but thank you for making my first experience at this location amazing! I will definitely be bringing my friends & family next time!

My husband and I loved this place so much we had them cater our wedding! The owner was EXTREMELY accommodating as he did not even have his food truck ready at the time and he managed to cater my wedding on the far east side of town anyway!! The food was absolutely delicious! The lamb shank is my absolute favorite and their jalapeño hummus is fantastic. We also loved the stuffed grape leaves and the chicken shawarma. This place was a total hit at our wedding and we received so many compliments on how delicious the food tasted. We love eating here!

First time here and from start to finish I was very impressed. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. The food was delicious and was very satisfied. I ordered the Frarej which is a recipe they've had in their family for 50 years. Loved it.

My life literally changed the moment I took a bite of the zucchini fries. That moment forward I've been a fan boi of #TheHummusFactoryLife the past few weeks! The Kaboobs and the handmade pita bread is LIFE! U have a lifelong supporter if you keep this up! I'm sending everyone here!

I've eaten here 6 or 7 times now, and I'm officially hooked.

*Perfect* falafel every time - crispy outside and just the right density on the inside. The chef here is a master of the falafel - this is not a simple achievement. One bite and you will be spoiled. The *only* other falafel in town that holds a candle to these are Amena Bakery's - and even so, you would never take a date to Amena. The Hummus Factory is the Total Wine of Mediterranean, and Amena is a downtown liquor store with a much smaller menu and barred windows (not really, but you know what I mean?) I can't think of anything that Amena does that The Hummus Factory can't do better.

Crazy good fresh hot pitas. Like should accompany your last-meal-on-Earth good. If you're going to cheat on your no-carb diet, you might as well do it here with absolutely no regrets.

They've also concocted the *best* Greek salad dressing of all time. And I was never one to be like, "Hmm, for lunch I'm feeling like a Greek salad..." But now I totally am. This Greek salad changes everything (see my Yelp photo) and it's a once-a-week choice for me when I'm in town.

All three items I've mentioned (the falafel, pitas, and Greek salad) are best-in-class in Las Vegas, and will set you up for disappointment when you order these things anywhere else. It's happened to me several times in the last month on the East Coast. Even my favorite Mediterranean place in Atlanta (where I lived for 7 years) is no longer good to me.

As a bonus, the current check-in offer with a dinner entrée is a complimentary plate of signature hummus - again, a exemplary rendition tastefully garnished with cucumber wedges at 3, 6, 9, and 12. Delicious stuff!

Hands down the best Mediterranean food in Las Vegas! I'm middle eastern and I love my grandmas cooking. I was very excited to try this out! I ordered to go, everyone was very friendly and welcoming. We ordered the fried zucchinis, gyro sandwiches, shrink scampi, and the hummus with beef! ABSOLUTELY impressed! I will definitely be back! Great establishment! I highly recommend

This place was awkward at first. When we walked in no one was there to sit us, I waited for a minute and then decided just to take a seat. However, once I went to sit down someone came out to help us. Not horrible, just awkward! The music also sounded a little like a Bollywood/slasher flick combined. There were moments it was terrifying and moments where it was fun and upbeat. There were several times I remarked to my date "do you hear this music?" 

Once we sat everything was pretty impressive. Our drinks were refilled on the regular. The first things that came out were the tabouli, pita bread, and eggplant fries with a side of Mediterranean butter. The fries came in a giant bowl. It was a lot more than we expected. They were good, but I preferred the zucchini fries that came later. The tabouli was citrusy/minty and delicious. The pita bread was puffy, like two slices of pita were stuck together and filled the middle with air. It wasn't bad, just not what I am used to. I actually may have liked it more because it felt "lighter." 

The next appetizer that came out was Hollaum Cheese ant was fantastic. It comes out with three pieces of fried Lebanese cheese and cut up tomatoes, cucumbers, and pickles. It's $12, so I do have to say it is expensive for what you get. I wish it had at least four pieces of cheese. However, it was certainly my favorite dish of the night, and if you love cheese it is a must try! 

Then our entrees came out, with my dates coming about 10 minutes after mine which was weird but forgivable. I had an entree size of the Greek salad, and it was HUGE. It was also incredibly unique. It had all the regular trappings of a Greek salad but also a little ZING. I don't know what gave it the kick at the end, but I ended up trading it for my partners beef shwarma. He LOVED the salad. The shwarma was eh. We subbed rice for zucchini fries - it was a good choice. Try something else tough.

I'm coming back to try those carrot fries!

Well all I have to say it Hummus Factory out did themselves again! From food truck to restaurant.. All I could say is that the food truck was delicious but the restaurant is even better! Not only the place is extremely clean, amazing atmosphere, great customer service but the place is very well designed.. Don't forget to try their kabobs. Their kabobs are to die for! I would to say it is really nice to know that the owner of this joint takes pride in this restaurant.. You can tell with all the details they put in to it. I will definitely come back again and again and again!
Everything on the menu is amazing.  The chicken shawarma and jalapeño hummus are very good.  Very fast and friendly service.  I highly recommend this place to everyone.

Went here with husband and two friends. Service was friendly, super sweet waitress. Hummus appetizer was fantastic...the pita bread was hot and expanded from being in the oven. I had the shawarma with gyro meat, delish. I think my favorite item was the Greek burger...grass fed beef with onion straws, and fries topped with feta cheese. So good. One of my friends ordered zucchini fries with his meal, which were also really tasty. Definitely plan to come back here, highly recommend.

Tried this spot the opening week, boy was I glad I did! Factory hummus made from scratch was delicious and on point! Tried the kabobs; holy smokes they were awesome. The filet kabob was tender and perfectly cooked, the chicken kabob was seasoned to perfection, and the shrimp kabob was so fresh!
Service was prompt and attentive and I was surprised when I got the bill.  More than fair prices for excellent food! Try this spot!
Everything is so fresh and seasoned perfectly. Amazing Falafel, the best I have eaten since I left NY over 21 years ago. Pickled Jicama...outstanding.  Sevice, outstanding. Can't wait to go back.

Good food especially hummus & pita
Both are homemade
Husband is from Lebanon & wife is from Vietnam Nam. Waitress is Thai. Sort of a little United Nations.
Very clean nice little place
Need to do something to let people know they are here
No beer or wine license  yet so you can bring your own which is nice for a $5 corkage fee.
Owners and staff are very friendly and attentive
We will return

Great food and service! Portions were really large. We ordered the eggplant fries,  (and also got the zucchini at no charge :) the factory hummus, a Greek salad, shish kabobs and dolmas. Everything was super fresh and delicious! Great job, keep it up, we'll definitely be back!
Holy crap! This place is awesome I'm so bringing everyone I know! Everything about it was great the food and the service

I'm more than a little puzzled that yet another Mediterranean restaurant has located itself in an area that is already loaded with them. The Hummus Factory, Hedary, Paymons, Zaytoon, Maza, and some others are located within the same general area, in some cases within a few blocks of each other. The Hummus factory menu is very similar to Hedary, so I ordered what I often get at Hedary:  Kafta skewers and lentil soup.  I have no complaints about what I got. It was good, but it wasn't as good as Hedary. The rice was OK but not as good as Hedary's (which is excellent). The pita bread, too, was good and fresh, but not as good as Hedary. Hedary is just a couple of blocks away from Hummus Factory, so I'll go there.
To respond to owner's comment: I agree with your reference to Chinatown, so maybe the congregation of Mediterranean restaurants is a similar concept. However, regardless of the origination of the recipes, if you choose to locate your restaurant a few blocks from Hedary's, and maintain a similar menu, you should expect your restaurant to be compared directly to Hedary's. Even though I liked your food (3 stars), I do not think it equaled Hedary's.

it is delicious food everyone, it you want to eating, just go in here for lunch and dinner as well ,I love the food and I love the waitress girl  her name Mimi she is amazing and nice to everyone, i would love to give here's 5 |*****

If I could, I would give a 3.5 star rating. Nice restaurant with a good atmosphere. Service was good and it has an A grade with the health district. I grew up on Mediterranean food so I know what it should take like.  The food had flashes of brilliance, but sometimes missed the mark. I had the eggplant fries. The coating and texture were show stoppers, but they were underseasoned. I also had the chicken gyro. Chicken was cooked to perfection but, again, the dish, including the tzatziki sauce were underseasoned. Pita bread was wonderful. I think that Maza Mediterranean is a better choice.

This restaurant is amazing. The freshest food, served piping hot. Creamiest hummus I've ever had. Service and hospitality was outstanding. Our go to spot every time we come to Vegas now. Owners are the sweetest people. Don't miss coming here, you won't be disappointed.

Omg!! The ghosts pepper hummus is spicyyyy!! I am currently sweating. It's delicious but extremely hot!!! I can handle spicy but oh my. I wanted to try it out because a lot of places say their food is spicy and it's not. The ghost pepper hummus however, is actually flames. I also had the habanero hummus is was delicious also, not as spicy. I asked for cucumber slices instead of pita and she was so nice and accommodated. She also gave us some pita on the side, it was freshly made and very good. The costumer service was GREAT! The lady that helped us out was so sweet and attentive. 5 stars for everything.

Miss the truck? Get over to the restaurant. Hummus Factory is awesome. 

The bread 5 stars
The chicken kabobs 5 stars
The babaganush 5 stars 
The lamb chops 5 stars 
And did I mention the bread.

Today I went to hummus factory for the first time.
I was amazed how regular office place can be turned into a really cute restaurant with a lot of details picture vintage stuff.
We got free Factory hummus with fluffy, hot, the best pita bread I have ever tried. Unlike other Mediterranean places where they gonna give you pita that you can buy in Walmart and heat it up this pita bread looked like homemade. 
Since I'm a big salad lover I ordered Fatoosh without any meat just greens. 
It was super delicious. A lot of flavors, well seasoned I loved pieces of Lebanese bread in it which wen great with those hummus leftovers we had - not a lot may I say. 
I had a few bites of eggplant fries from my companions plate - Yum!
We were offered with desert and Lebanese coffee (which I highly recommend to any coffee lover).
Check out this place I loved it!

Best middle eastern cuisine at a great price! Great clean location with nice decor. Great food and friendly, prompt service. Nikki is a wonderful host and server! I will absolutely come here again. Everything was prepared fresh and was so yummy!

RESCUED BY RESTAURANT OWNER!!! 

Yup!  This just happened.  I am able to write this review in the comfort of my own home thanks to restaurant owner & chef, Tony.  He saw that my husband and I could not get our car started after eating at The Hummus Factory and immediately offered to help.  Luckily for us, Tony used to be a mechanic before becoming a fantastic chef and he still loves to tinker with cars.  What are the odds?!  

He popped the hood & diagnosed the problem - corroded, dead battery :/  

Here's the thing... I JUST had my car serviced by AutoNation Toyota (on Sahara) 2 days ago - for the 40K mile maintenance.  I also asked the techs to please check EVERYTHING else because I have a long road trip ahead of me.   A corroded battery should have been brought to my attention!  But...NOPE.  So, guess who will be getting a bad review?  That's right, AutoNation Toyota, you're now on my sh** list!

Anyway...back to Tony.  I was already planning a repeat trip to The Hummus Factory with friends & family because my husband and I had just finished a fabulous meal served to us by Tony's sister, Alida.  I wanted to wait to write my review until I've had more items though.  But after what Tony did tonight, I had to Yelp about him. 

(By the way, we have USAA roadside assistance & Toyota Assist.  But neither could get us up and running tonight.)

Tony cleaned the battery & tried several times to jump start it.  But, no go.  So, he drove us to O'Reilly's for a new battery and installed it for us FREE OF CHARGE!  We offered to compensate Tony.  But, he absolutely refused.  

Y'all - Tony & his amazing family deserve some serious Yelp love and good karma.  His sister, wife, & mom work at the restaurant & offered us drinks and a cool place to hang out during all this.  We seriously would have been in a bind and without a car for days had they not helped us.  

Thank you, Tony, Alida, Nikki, & "mom"!  (Sorry if I spelled your names wrong.)  Unbelievable customer service!!!  Delicious food, dessert, & coffee!  We will 100% be back and can't sing your praises enough.

****************************************

UPDATE:  We've been back on our own & with work colleagues.  Last night, we hosted a dinner for 20.  We literally wanted to try everything on the menu & needed help.  So, we rounded up some folks...all first timers.  Our group was very well taken care of from beginning to end.  We enjoyed everything on the menu.  Really cannot go wrong with anything here.  

NOTE:  The ghost pepper hummus was too spicy for most in our group.  But, I loved it!
We found this place by accident. Everything was really good. George took good care of us. We live across town & will make an effort to come back
The bread comes to the table fresh and hot with an herb butter, every thing we've tried here is delicious, and they deliver via grub hub

I love hummus so I had to stop by this place!  I just moved to the area and saw the sign.  I ordered to go two gyros with fries and the jalapeno hummus with pita bread.  The FRIES and sauce were delicious.  Hummus pretty good and the gyro good.  I will definitely be back.  Service was excellent and quick.  The waitress was very nice and I love the decor and ambience.

The BEST falafel I have ever had, and I have had some good falafel! The hummus, as you can imagine, is amazing. Good creamy texture and lots of different flavors. Had the jalapeño hummus which was delicious but not as spicy as I had hoped. Aleeta (spelling?) was warm and welcoming, great service! 

The atmosphere is more upscale than I expected. I was thinking this would be a casual dining experience. I was thinking a little more "fast casual dining" but this has more of a restaurant feel. I would recommend this place for a business meeting.

A bit more expensive in price compared to other great Mediterranean spots but the portions were large!!! We got the Factory burger and the Gyro sandwich. The gyro meat was super thick and tasty. And the Greek fries!!! Omg what is the seasoning?! Because it was so yummy. All of the ingredients were super fresh and tasty. Would definitely come again.

Not good. 
That's all we can say. 
We ordered three entree to try and all were just basic,  even blah.
We were hopeful! Place is clean and organized. But should have been busier. 
When you walk in on a weekend and you're the only people.... hmmm. 
Where should we be?
Really nice lady in front smiles and makes up feel welcomed i had the gyro and eggplant  fries with lemonade  really good fresh i love their bread

The food here is fantastic! Dined in the first time I ate here & took food to go the second time. Both experiences were wonderful. Husband cooks amazing dishes & wife provides excellent service in the dining area - they make a great team. Mezza is awesome for trying many different options. I was very impressed with the falafel & that's the deal breaker for me at a Mediterranean restaurant.

I tried to get a groupon for their neighbor hotpot restaurant but it rejected me twice. When we got outside the hot pot place it was empty so we kinda doubted. Then we chance upon Hummus Factory i had to Yelp first then decided to try it and hoping they have that freshly made pita from another Mediterranean place that starts with K. Tory the server was very pleasant and though we were the only one there tonight it felt more inviting. I used my free Hummus in Yelp and I ordered eggplant fries (based on reviews) and hubby got chicken shawarma dinner with baba ganoush as recommended by Tory. We got our hummus first that was so creamy and tasty and piping hot pita with herbed butter (yummy) that was more delicious than "K".  In our former Med resto I only eat the pita and their grape seed oil and just share from my husband's order. The flavor of the chicken shawarma and the pink sauce combo plus the rice was so scrumptious I almost want to finish his meal. There was a white sauce Tatziki maybe for the shawarma but hubby liked the my pink sauce better. My eggplant fries was awesome too but I'd like it more crispy (personal pref) again pink sauce...the bomb!  This is a gem that I started telling my friends to try it while still in the restaurant. Verdict:  I'll be back!!! I now love Mediterranean food but only in this place from now on.  Thanks Tory for a great service!!!  We couldn't finish the big portions and wanted our daughter to have some. When she got home she already ate. If I still had space in my tummy I still wanted to finish it but that's gluttony. Lol

Wow. I was pleasantly surprised by how wonderful the food, staff and ambiance is at Hummus Factory. We tried a bunch of things as we always do to assess the restaurant and we were not disappointed. Everything is fresh, made on site and full of flavor. Here is the run down:
Homemade fresh lemonade - amazing 
Regular Humus - amazing (ordered two)
FRESH pita - yes, yes and yes! 
Eggplant French fries - ok but won't order again
Fatoosh salad - ok but there are other good things
Kibbe platter - amazing 
Chicken shawarma platter - amazing 
(The rice and veggies that came with the platter were fantastic too). 

We can't wait to return - perfect for lunch, dinner, large parties and dinner with the kiddies.

Omg. So freaking good. Great authentic taste in every bite. I would recommend this place 100 times over. Hands down to you guys, you are doing a great job. I'm definitely coming back. Thank you for an awesome experience Alida.

YUM! Everything here was delicious. Hint: there is currently a Yelp Check-In Offer for a free hummus with the purchase of an entree, and it is amazing! My colleague and I stopped after work while we were in Vegas, and it was the perfect spot. The ambiance was relaxing and quiet, especially after a long day. We ordered the halloumi cheese and the kafta plate. Everything was fantastic! Very flavorful. Another hint: they do not have alcoholic beverages listed on their menu, but if you ask they do have such beverages available :)

Lovely space, staff warm and welcoming.
Food wonderful. I have Falafel Plate which was a huge amount of crisp non greasy falafel balls served on a bed of marinated veggies. All super good. Had a side order of baba ganoush which was lovely. I tasted the hummus which is light and very creamy. Pita bread came to the table puffed, warm and delicious.  We were a party of 15 people which they handled beautifully. It is a new restaurant in business for 3 weeks, Go there for wonderful Lebanese food.
THIS PLACE IS ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!!!!! The food was great and the service was spectacular! I definitely recommend this place!!!!!

Probably the best falafel in all of Nevada!
U will be hooked and go back for more. Good job guys!!
Have been here 4 times now this month and it's truly wonderful fresh and delicious!  Highly recommended!

The food is always delicious. We've never been disappointed.
Lunch or dinner. Fabulous and the service is great too.

Love this place so glad I don't have to stalk them around town and even better they opened 1 block from where I work on Mondays so I go frequently. Portions have always been huge always need a to go box. Tried the pretzel sliders, factory burger, chicken kabobs and regular hummus all SOOOOO good. I have wanted to upgrade and try both of the other types of fries but I always end up spending the extra $$ on hummus and pita bread because I feel empty without it. Restaurant is nice and clean. I usually go during less busy times so I haven't had long waits. Waitresses have been very nice every time. Service always good first time there they were out of pretzel bread so they nicely came over and let me know and apologized which is all I ask for no biggie I had like a list of things I needed to try so I moved on to the next one. Great place! Hope it succeeds.
This is the second time we've eaten here - by far the best Greek we've had in Las Vegas!

I honestly gave up on trying Mediterranean food because I'd never like anything and wasted the food. Not until recently, honestly if I could give this place 6 stars I would!! I didn't have my phone the day I came here so no pictures but damn do I regret that. I really loved the shawarmas and eggplant fries. Generously salted here and the service was excellent. The waitress I got was very young and quirky and made my experience a lot better since she was very informative and attentive to my needs. The ambiance I say is pretty formal. This place deserves more attention and the people who run it seem humble and easy to talk to. Thank you guys for the amazing food and great service!! Will be coming here every time I'm in the area.

The Hummus Factory is the perfect place to have a quiet lunch by yourself or to catch up with an old friend. Each time I have visited, they are never overcrowded and the service is always amazing. I never know what to order when I eat out and they are never short on suggestions.

Today we tried the jalapeño hummus, which is all the yum! I love spicy food and thought the jalapeño was relatively mild so I ordered the ghost pepper hummus to take home to my fiancé. YIKES! The flavor is amazing but shortly after your first bite, the ghost peppers smack you right in the face. I'll stick with the jalapeño next time. I also ordered a greek salad with salmon and split it with my friend. The salmon was fresh and cooked perfectly. The salad was gigantic! Needless to say, we came hungry and left satisfied.

I'll definitely keep coming to The Hummus Factory!

The Hummus Factory is an amazing find. I love this kind of food and this place did not disappoint. Started with the fresh hummus and pita which was outstanding. I got the chicken kebab plate that comes with a side salad and rice. The seasoning and portions are great. I took some Baklava home for dessert. Fresh, delicious and super friendly service. I'd go back next time I'm in town for sure.

I had the beef shawarma wrap and some ghost pepper hummus with an additional side of veggies for dipping.  The shawarma was an above average rendition but nothing too noteworthy.  The dish comes with a side of fries for free or can be upgraded to specialty fries for about $3 or hummus for an additional upcharge.  The wrap meal came to about $10 before tax.

The main standout was the ghost pepper hummus.  This stuff will put you on your back.  I ordered delivery so maybe that was the reason, but the hummus consistency was a little runny.  Spectacularly spicy but a tiny bit runny.  I still put the spice level up to any hummus I've ever encountered.  Couple that with a fantastic taste, and this stuff is the real deal.  It came with a fine piece of pita and the veggies were large for the $4 price point with inclusions of carrots, green peppers, and cumbers.  If you're a fan of spicy, take a taste with the ghost pepper hummus.  You won't be disappointed.

Very good food. Delicious. Friendly and fast servers. I think the owners came by, but I was too busy eating to look up. Nice atmosphere. Very clean. Big portions. Large menu, lots of selections. Of course the hummus was great. Pitas were fresh..Yum. Gyros. Good Tzatziki sauce. Salads were authentic, Baba ganoush was excellent. We tried a lot of things...big party. We had them just keep bringing us food. I think they brought us everything. Bill was expensive, but I think it was worth it. Good time.
From the minute you walk in the staff issuer nice and the FOOD omg pictures don't do it justice!! It's a must try!!! The lemonade is a must

Ironically, The Hummus Factory only has four kinds of hummus, but the food here is amazing! 

The interior is fairly spacious and the service has always been excellent. I have been here twice now (once for lunch, and once for dinner), and had wonderful experiences.

As for the food itself, portions are definitely generous, and the prices are fair. The freshly-baked hot bread is one of the highlights for sure!

The flavors of all the food are great, and it is clear that a lot of care and passion goes into cooking this food. Most of the menu offerings are Mediterranean cuisine, and I believe primarily Lebanese in origin.

They have a lot of unique fries (I love the eggplant and zucchini fries), and the jalapeno hummus packed quite some heat!

I highly recommend The Hummus Factory, would go more often if it weren't so far from my house!

This place is really nice. The moment I walked in, I was greeted and sat down immediately. I noticed all the fresh herb plants all around the restaurant. The prices were decent compared to other places, which is why I decided to try this place. I ordered the gyro (which comes with fries) and my BF ordered the sujuk (spicy beef sausage) which came with a side (he ordered the tabbuli). As I check into Yelp, a free hummus comes up! Yay!! They gave us fresh pita bread and butter infused with all these fresh herbs. Yum! The tabbuli was fresh and the greens were crispy. The seasoning on the salad was light and delicious. They also have freshly squeezed lemonade, which I should try next time. The gyro was delicious, but not omg good. It's comparable to a lot of other gyros I have tried. The sujuk was juicy and at the end was a kick of spice which I really enjoyed. What I like about this place, are the portion sizes. They are very generous with the portions, the food is great with awesome price points, with amazing service.
first time been in this restaurant.... it has great mediterranean food.... friendly staffs and excellent service... plus free wifi so we could eat and social...
Greek salad is amazing and huge!! It's the best in town! Was hoping they had shawarma, maybe next time. Food had good flavor and big portions.

Ordered through grub hub and received my food very fresh and hot. The lentil soup was amazing. Will order again
 Thank you!!
Some of the best falafel I have ever had. Service was amazing. Lunch portions were huge. A new go to place for sure. Can not wait to try all the different options!

First off I just wanted to say that this place was not only relaxing but has a comforting environment.. The server was extremely friendly and super attentive! The owner even came out to greet us for coming in! This place is a must if you love mediterranean foods. The gyro was super good and don't skimp on the meat :) this is probably the best gyro I've eaten in a long time and plus it's close to home!  I highly recommend trying this place out and don't forget to order that hummus!
First time try the hummus, server was helpful with us. Heated the story that this restaurant was a food truck before. Food quality is good. Will recommend friends to try it.

Not your typical Mediterranean cuisine!
The jalapeño hummus is fantastic but definitely has a kick of spicy!
Salads are great! Crisp lettuce with fresh ingredients and nice spices.
I did not love the lentil appetizer but everything else was great! Excited to try more.
Restaurant was clean with cute, industrial restaurant equipment used to inspire decor.

Came in for the first time and I am so glad I chose this place the atmosphere is perfect everything is so new and clean love all the little details. The staff makes you feel at home. Best of all was the food !! Fresh and so delicious I'm going back today for lunch. Yesterday I had the factory burger with zucchini fries and I couldn't stop even after I was stuffed...Their tabouli salad was the best I've ever had too!!

If you want the BEST pita bread and hummus in town this is the place to go. Seriously they make everything homemade and I literally had the best hummus I've had here in town in over 20 years!!!! The interior it's cozy and quaint superior service.  Will definetly come back here again just do have their pita and hummus!

Kinda stumbled across this place one day while having a huge falafel craving. My favorite falafels I have had in Las Vegas. Vegan friendly options that will leave you wanting more. Everything is incredibly fresh from (again) the falafel, to the hummus, to the vegetables and don't even get me started on the bread!!! What a hidden gem this place is! Do your tastebuds a favor and GO!
Gotta check this place out!! We stumbled upon it and were thrilled by the delicious food, cool atmosphere and great service. Seriously. Highly recommend!!

Food was the delicious my favorite was the zucchini fries and the kafta. 
The restaurant was very nice and modern and clean. The owners were very caring as they checked on us many times during our meal. 
Check them out it was yummy

Very nice atmosphere for our first time here. The food was very good but for the price and amount that you get with each order, we will not be coming here very often. Lunch for 2 with 2 entree's was $43.00 with tip. Nice staff.

Wanted to try this place today and pulled up to find a taped up sign that said "gone fishing". Really? That's just terrible business. Sorry that fishing was more important than running your business during advertised business hours. Lame!

This is the best mediterainian food I have ever had..
I even had the lamb for the furst time in my life..
Mazen was our waiter and he took care of completely..
Definately will be returning evey chance we get.
The portion size was enough to feed 4 people...
I had the spinach salad with gyro...simply amazing..thank you for making our experience a fantastic one..
See you soon my new friends..
Susanna & mike.......

We went there for lunch. Ordered the hummus which was too lemony. Also had the Shish kabobs which had no taste the rice was bland the salad wasn't great. Beef stew wasn't good at all. What a way to spend almost 40 bucks on Lunch!!!!

Won't be coming here again!!

The restaurant has delicious food. I believe the owner's cousin works there which makes it advantageous to get great service. She really seems to care and treats everybody with respect and courtesy. I don't know how they make their chicken but the chicken breast is extremely soft and juicy and extremely tasty. The hummus is outstanding and the bread that they have is out of this world. Very light and Airy you just can't get enough. I highly recommend this place for lunch or dinner

Although limited in my experience with Mediterranean food, I have to go all in for the Hummus Factory with the 5 stars.  Two of us came here to share various items.  The restaurant had few customers at 5 PM on Friday night.

We ordered:

Factory hummus order and pita (free with Yelp check in)
Falafel appetizer with fresh vegetables and tahini sauce
Meat combination with one beef kabob, one kafta, one sujuk and one kibbi with baba ghanoush (susbstiution of zucchini fries for rice for an upcharge)
Gyro sandwich (substitute eggplant fries instead of rice for an upcharge)
Baklava
Rice pudding
Shabiet

I ordered an iced tea also and was brought refills several times without needing to ask.  I also asked if I could sample their ghost pepper sauce that you can get with hummus.  Our server, Nikki, brought a small cup of the sauce and warned me to only dip the pita in a little bit of the sauce.  That's what I did and immediately started hiccuping from the reaction to the heat of the ghost pepper.  I won't be eating that--it is very hot as I guessed it would be.

First off before trying the ghost pepper sauce, we were brought an order of hummus and very hot, house made pita bread.  Both were excellent.  The pita was so light and fluffy in texture.  It was with a small piece of the pita that I tries the ghost pepper sauce.  We also had a small round of butter that was flavorful with the pita.

Next up came the falafel appetizer.  Good falafels with good tasting tahini and a selection of fresh vegetables to go with the falafel.  Next came our two main courses.  One was a gyro sandwich with zucchini fries and one was the meat combination with eggplant fries and an order of baba ghanoush.  Of the fries, the eggplant were better to my taste although the zucchini were good, too.  Good gyro.  The meat combination was very good.  Standout on this dish was the sujuk--spicy sausage.  The spice was perfect for this meat.

We ended our meal with 3 desserts, baklava, rice pudding, and shabiet.  The baklava is much different than I've had before.  There is honey but it's not dripping or swimming in honey.  In addition, it's small in width and shaped like a piece of Kit Kat.  Very tasty and a different way of making it.  The rice pudding was quite creamy and very good and last, the shabiet with its ashta cream was very good.  The shabiet is shaped like a turnover and has this wonderful cream inside.

Part of my five stars also is for the service.  Our factory worker, Nikki, was really a pleasant woman who was quite interesting to speak with and she was always there to refill iced tea or my companion's water glass.

It's quite a story that this brick and mortar restaurant came about after its start as a food truck restaurant.

Just wanted to say we had lunch here today. I have to say this restaurant was amazing! The waitress Alida was so , so nice and very prompt with serving the larger than expected portions of food plus the  restaurant was very clean.  I would recommend the Hummus Factory to anyone who enjoys Mediterranean food.
Cynthia:)))))
