Great food and service. Everything was beyond fresh and tasty. Will definitely be back
The food was awesome... we ordered the veggie dolma, hummus and chicken shawarma... all were very good. Service was good as well. We can't wait to be back

This may be best Mediterranean restaurant in town.  I've eaten at fine Mediterranean restaurants around the globe and Hummus Factory definitely stands out.  

I've eaten here well over 30 times either at lunch in the restaurant or via food delivery for dinner.  The food is always consistent and very well marinated.  The marination is key.  All food items are flavorful.  My favorite item is the chicken kabob plate.  The dinner portions are plentiful.  Ally is a server I see often and she is always pleasant and attentive.  

I almost always see the owner in the kitchen working on the cooking.  I imagine he works long hours and provides a lot of oversight which help insures consistent quality.  

If you love Mediterranean food like I do, this is a spot worth checking out.
The best mediterranean food in Las Vegas  I enjoyed everything from the friendly staff such a beautiful restaurant open kitchen beautiful Decour

My good friend drug me to dinner here for getting out of the house therapy. I am so glad that I did. The menu here was explained to me by the wonderful waiter that we had and I ended up ordering the Shawarma sandwich because it sounded yummy and since Robert Downey Jr recommended it in Avengers. As the side option I had zucchini fries with extra feta cheese. The sandwich meat was chicken and was so moist , normally I hate onions and forgot to have them taken off. The way they were cooked into the meat it mixed well with the chicken and I went for it. While I did pull the big pieces of onion out I still ate the sandwich cooked in onion

We also ordered the Greek fries to to try them, but with extra feta and those were great as well. The atmosphere of the restaurant was casual and upbeat. The wait staff was wonderful. I love the take that they do with the food her it is not overtly overwhelming and left us with pleasant after tastes. I would visit again as well .
The BEST Hummus I ever had! Awesome service and great food. I had the Lentil soup and Shrimp Scampi.

Ok so this sucks that I have to give them 2 stars I would love to give them 5 but unfortunately due to a lack of customer service and not with the servers but more management so I have come in here atleast 6 times and I will say I love the food it's amazing haven't had a bad thing but I brought my husband in with me about two weeks ago after leaving he realized he forgot his hat I called it had been no more than 10 mins since we left the women on the phone said yes we have it Ill put it up for you I informed her I wouldn't be in to pick it up for a week she said no problem and we hung up I came in less than a week later and she instantly recognized me and said oh your hat let me grab it when she went to get it where she left it she found it was gone she asked everyone that was at work if they moved it no one said they had the manger than got involved first trying to tell me we don't have your hat no one ever called us about it basically saying I was lying than I said no this women here remembers she informed him yes this is true he than asked for my number so he could ask around and call he called me back about 2 hours later but I was at work and couldn't answer I than called him that same day and left him a message only for him to never return my call I came in a week later to grab lunch and find out what happen to my hat they told me they no idea about a hat and they don't have it the manger didn't even come out to speak with me even though I saw he was there they didn't discount my meal as an I'm sorry we lost or stole your hat obviously it's just a hat I will replace it but I was treated like I was lying given the runaround and was never even giving an apology it sucks cause I really do love it here and the day waitress is so sweet but I just don't know if I can return to a place that treats their customers this way 2 stars are for the day waitress I wish I knew her name and the food is good but there is great food everywhere  in vegas how I'm treated matters

Holy crap.. talk about delicious! I spotted The Hummus Factory when I recently took a job in the same strip mall. It was dangerously delicious. I opted for the Greek salad with chicken- its steeply price but good to know enough to feed a small army- making it worth it! The fresh bread and butter was a perfect touch. I didn't notice the free hummus with yelp check in until later, but will definitely take advantage next time.. aka tomorrow. I don't have a single complaint!
The food was really Amazing, and the Service was even more amazing. I luv our server her name is Happy,  see her and enjoy the food and the wonderful service.
Excellent service friendly staff, the food was fresh and delicious. Nice interior. Would highly recommend.

Wow ..... what a place !! A hidden gem in the Las Vegas desert. You must try the jalapeño hummus with the freshly baked peta bread. The chicken kobob is dynamite and you can't forget about their homemade lemonade with crushed ice.

This family-owned, food truck turned restaurant is amazing! We chatted with one of the owners who was also serving us. She was such a sweetheart and funny as hell.

To start off the evening, I came in to have dinner with my boyfriend and his family. The service was slow at first but that was completely understandable because there was only one person taking care of the entire restaurant.

They offered a variety of flavors of hummus, which they are known for: original, jalapeño and ghost pepper. The texture was so smooth and creamy. But my favorite part was the warm fluffy bread they served with it. The owner kept coming by to give us more. It was impossible to resist myself from breaking open the warm pita and plowing it in my mouth.

For the main course, I ordered the kafta (ground sirloin mixed with onions, parsley and spices) which reminded me of a koobideh kabab. It was served with a side of rice and onions. While it was flavorful, it wasn't the best kabob I've ever had. 

Dessert is what blew my mind. We had the custard filled Shabiet! Served warm, the crunchy layers of pastry flaked and melded perfectly with the creamy custard. 

Y'all! This place is deeeelicious. Just sad that it's a trek for me but I'll be sure to drop in again if I'm in the neighborhood.
The food is so fresh, the place is so clean and the atmosphere is just amazing. Will be coming here again and frequent.
What a great spot for amazing food and ambiance!!  I'm a professed hummus 'snob'...this is amazing!  Can't wait to come back!!!  Try it out!  Julie B

Dude. 

Insane flavors going on here. First off, if youre going to come here, clear your mind of traditional Mediterranean food. They have their own twist on things-you gotta if you want to really appreciate what they do.  

Wait service was awesome. Pleasant. Helpful. Funny! Offered bread refills very often. Never an empty glass. 

Food: Baba ganoush. Do it. Factory hummus. Get it. The pita. You already know. AND it's fresh baked. My friend had the pretzel bun sliders. To quote, "this is the best burger I've ever had." He said in a wonder. I had the sausage with lemon sauce.  Delicious. Possibly my only complaint was that it was a tad dry in comparison to everything else but maaaaan. Them flavors. Mmm. Mmm. Definitely coming back. 

P.s. bathrooms were clean as a whistle and they honored the yelp check in!

Omg the food was amazing! At first I thought the prices were a bit high for Mediterranean food, but when dinner came I realized how worth it it was! The portions are huge and leftovers lasted me 2 meals. And in addition, the food was absolutely delicious and great quality! I got the chicken kebabs which came with rice and greens. Boyfriend got the kibbeh, which was both of our favorites. I'd never had anything like that before and loved it. I think that's our new date night spot.

Hummus Factory is not too far from where I work and so we decided to go here for lunch.  I had the hummus plus protein and it comes with a choice of side.  I got the salad.  It was HUGE!  And it comes with fresh pita as well.  Loved it, the dressing was good and very flavorful.  The plate that you receive with the protein and hummus was big.  I had enough hummus to take home.

Service was quick and server was very polite and nice.  Would for sure visit again!

Stopped in again. Everything was great! Food was hot fresh and delicious. Service was great and the food came out much faster than last time. I also ordered the lemon dressing on my Greek salad instead of the vinaigrette that comes on it, and it was amazing!

Food is amazing. Very fresh. We love Mediterranean food and this is now our favourite spot. We ordered the fatoosh salad. It had so much flavor. Also the eggplant fries where delicious with the Greek burger. A great lunch spot or quiet dinner.

I'm ruined! The Greek salad was so incredibly tasty that we aren't sure any other place will even compete! Tory, our waitress, took great care of us and treated us like family. The pita bread! Omg! Most delicious thing ever!!!!!
Food is great every time! And always have Nikki as my server, she's fantastic and so sweet. Thank you for the great service Nikki!

Love this place! Food is to die for, their eggplant fries are amazing, I want to come back every day if I could! Flavors are amazing and all the food is so fresh! Also the owners are super nice and the whole atmosphere so friendly with great music! Would highly recommend this place for lunch or dinner

I had the Greek salad with gyro meet and an order of hummus. Best Greek salad I ever had. Dressing was understated and not over powering. Home made bread is a real treat. Service was also outstanding drank 4 ice teas and  was never empty.

Found this place on yelp and decided to give it a try. My friend and I shared the halloum cheese, hummus, falafel entrée and fatoosh. It was all delicious, especially the cheese.  It is family owned, and the owners and their daughter were all really friendly. The atmosphere was really nice, too. I would definitely come back, and there are many more things on the menu I want to try!

Came in 2:30 pm, lots of take out for a sit down restaurant. Pleasant & clean environment. Lebanese coffee is like a Turkish one, very good. Chix gyros different from Greek ones but good. Not as much garlic or oregano, but the happy spices on it had an orange hue. The gyro's are served with too much french fries! Outside seating was inviting. Server friendly but very busy doing everything except cook. Curious to try the other dishes.
It was super yummy I have the  Gyro and fries we have the shrimp scampi we have the factory hummus of the zucchini fries everything was super yummy I was very tasteful and we deathly go back again

I stumbled upon this place while driving down sahara and decided WHY NOT! We went inside and it wasn't very busy which was totally sad because the inside of the restaurant is so cute and clean. I love the plants everywhere. I originally wanted to order a burger but they were out of the toppings that came on it so the waitress recommended the steak kabobs- I went with those. DELICIOUS!! I wanted to order tabouli as well but they were out of that too- a little disappointing that 2/3 items that I wanted, they were out of. However, my meal was so good and made up for that so I will be back!
To make a long story short; right out of the oven fluffy delicate bread, Jalapeño Hummus, Fatoosh, Tabuli, & Chicken Kabob... "DELICIOUS!!!"

This is the best Mediterranean food I have had in Vegas. Everything I have tried has been absolutely amazing! Everything is so fresh, and the spices have the best flavor without being overwhelming. I plan to come back and make my way through the whole menu. The owners are so kind and welcoming. Love love love The Hummus Factory!

We were somewhat dismayed when we looked at the menu, seeing that prices seemed very high compared to other Mediterranean restaurants we frequent.  That evaporated once they brought the food, and we were faced with astronomical portion sizes that would feed us for a second (and in my case third) meal.

We started with the hummus that was free with Yelp check-in:  beautifully presented, along with a basket of warm, puffed pita straight from the oven, and adorned with multiple slices of Persian cucumber.  That's helpful for limiting the amount of bread you need to eat.  Cukes are great for dipping into hummus, and the hummus is made of a combination of fava beans and chickpeas, very authentic.

For our main courses, hubby ordered the chicken kebab, and I decided on something I don't usually order, baked kibbe.  We both had salad for our side dishes, and were served with large bowls with mixed greens, onion, tomatoes, and more of those yummy Persian cukes.  I had my dressing on the side, and it was an unusual mix of oil, lemon, salt, pepper, and mint.  I was so full from the hummus, half a piece of pita, and the salad that I could have stopped there.  But I didn't.

When the plates were brought out, I thought I would faint from the amount of food.  The kebabs had three skewers of chicken, each chock-full of meat, with a spicy-ish sauce basted on top, sitting on enough Lebanese rice to feed a family of four.  I tried the chicken, and it was the best chicken kebab ever.

The star of the presentation was my kibbe.  When I had it at other restaurants years ago, it was always a square of re-warmed stuff cut out of a larger baking dish.  That's probably why I stopped ordering it.  My dish here had three individual gigundo balls of fresh kibbe, surrounding a center of meat, seasonings, and pine nuts, sitting atop an atomic-sized portion of the aforementioned rice, along with a roasted tomato.  Totally different from what I was expecting, and incredibly good.  I had to force myself to finish just one of those balls.  It was a tough job, not because it was bad, but because I was stuffed to the gills.

Service was exceptional from Alida, the owner's sister, and the young woman, also family, whose name I didn't get.  The TVs did NOT have sports playing - YAY!!, and the background music was terrific.

Don't let the prices deter you - the quality is exceptional and the value is definitely worth it.  We started out disgruntled and ended up converted.  We will go back, for sure!!

Loved this place.  Great service... Clean...But most of all... The food is awesome. Try the Eggplant fries. Amazing. I didn't have the heart to tell my seven year old grandson that he was eating "vegetables". He gobbled them up. I'll be back and I'll recommend to my friends.

I adored this restaurant. Our server Nikki was so attentive and sweet, making sure we all always had what we needed. The food was also  delicious which was definitely a plus. I will definitely be coming back as soon as I can.

Get yourself to hummus factory. Spotless restaurant, sweet staff, delicious food. Plus, we just fed three and split dessert for $41. My husband did a gyro and fries, which was perfect. Kid and I did the split 6 apps deal and it was outstanding. The pita and hummus is so good, but the baba ganoush stole the show. The baklava was sooooo good and one piece was big enough for the three of us. I'm planning to come back tomorrow to pick up more food to take to a party. I'm so glad we finally checked this place out!
Great food! Nikki was super nice and fast. The chicken kabobs had so much flavor! Will definitely be back.

I haven't raved about a place like this in a looooong time. My husband grew up in a Lebanese household so he's been spoiled with good food that I can't easily replicate. I took him here to surprise him and let him reminisce about home, and it was AMAZING. I'm definitively not an adventurous eater, but I'd try about anything here. He exposed me to everything he had and it was delicious, as was my meal. The waitress was so very friendly too--her brother owns the place apparently. The place was so intimate and beautiful, though minimalistic and urban. We are definitely going to be regulars here. The prices are so great for the quality and quantity that you get here too. Will be recommending to everyone!!!
The best hummus in town... and everything else is really good too! One of our favorite places to eat. Everyone is always so friendly. You can't beat this place!
The food is awesome and the service is great. My favorite is the Fatoosh salad with chicken, salmon or shrimp, eggplant fries and jalapeno hummus.

I really want to like this place, but after three visits I'm finally done. First off, every time we've visited it has been insanely hot. It's as if they don't use the air conditioning and only the ceiling fans. Very uncomfortable especially when there is so much sunlight in through the windows. And the service is just super slow.  Usually I am ok with slow service if the food is amazing, but with the uncomfortable temperature, it just seems to take even longer.

I love this place, more specifically their pita bread and their zucchini fries.  Their pita bread is so fresh and it's addicting!  Also the zucchini fries are seasoned well along with a nice crunch before getting to the center.  It's served with a sauce similar to a spicy mayo.  I usually get the gyro or the chicken sandwich.  The service is always A1 also!

We stopped in here when we were looking for Mediterranean/Middle Eastern restaurants. We knew Tony the Hummus Factory food truck. We didn't know he opened a restaurant. 

We knew the food would be good but it was great. The portions were generous and reasonably priced. 

We started with the Halloum Cheese, delicious. 

For mains, I had the meat combo. The kabob was perfectly cooked but the kafta and kibbi were the stand outs. The kafta had great flavor and was slightly spicy, just spicy enough to make your eyes water a little and keep you wanting more.

The kibbi, oh my. My wife is middle eastern and I have to say, this is the best I have ever had. (Sorry to my mother in law, good thing she doesn't read this stuff) The flavors were amazing. Perfectly seasoned. Nice and crispy on the outside..mmmmm

My wife had the falafal and she said it was good, I had one and thought the same. 

We will definitely be back!

the chicken shawarma and the steak fries... i died a little inside when i took my first bite, it was too bomb i thought i was going to be elevated to a higher existence. seriously. this place. also the staff is very friendly and they're always on top of it!

Tried the Ghost pepper hummus. It was truly lit.. i have tried falafel plate and wrap.. wrap comes with side of fries. They make there fresh pocket pita bread. Also ask for garlic butter with bread.. that tasted so good.
I also liked the ambience of the place.
Highly recommend this place for lunch.

Went for lunch on Saturday and it was a great experience.  We started with the "check in" hummus and carrot fries, both of which were fresh and tasty.  My wife & I had the meat combo and the portions were huge.  The kebob meat was a bit overdone and chewy, but the rest was cooked perfectly.  My daughter had a burger, which was excellent as well.  I got an order of ghost pepper hummus to go and it definitely had some heat.  Overall:  excellent food & service.

I forgot to add the waitress was exceptional very patient described all the food selections to us and  our service was wonderful. This place was absolutely delicious. It was recommended to me by my daughter in law. I am a vegetarian and there are a lot of vegetarian options as well as vegan options that suits my daughter and her children. My son is a carnivore and there was plenty for him to eat as well. The food was fresh, well priced, and delicious. The bread was freshly-baked and hot. The hummus is probably the best that I have had. All in all, it was one of the best lunches I've had in a long time and although I ate too much, I will definitely come back again.

Great food and friendly people. The atmosphere is relaxed and casual and the food is tasty. I had the chicken gyro sandwich and the humus appetizer. The flavors and quality of the food were great. I would eat here again.

I might just give my right leg for their absolutely amazing jalepeno hummus. The bread that they serve with it is nothing short of glorious, warm, fluffy yet perfectly crisp, and is freshly made. The gyro's are out of this world and the amount of fries they give you fill you up beyond capacity. Very friendly and welcoming staff, exceptional food, and calm atmosphere. Love this place!

Top notch! 

Absolutely outstanding!

I will have to update this when I have time to sit down at a real keyboard, but we can't remember being this blown away by a meal, possibly ever. Everything was wonderful, but for now, I want to touch on one item:

The Baba Ganoush 

 I'm no expert on Mediterranean cuisine. As such, baba ganoush has always been a "sure, I'll have some" kind of thing for me. I could take it or leave it. 

Not this, though. This had so much more flavor than any I've ever had. If previous incarnations were a 4, The Hummus Factory's version is a 14! This is something special and I cannot say enough good things about it.

I dont know how the food tastes because i go in at 8:40 pm to place a to go order but the coworker or whoever said we are closed. I then say no you close at 9:00 but she told me we close the kitchen at 8:40. Even though she was making someone elses food in the mean time. I dont know... terrible service and would never think about going back.

Friendly and simple atmosphere at The Hummus Factory. Quick and accurate service. We had the hummus and tabulli as a starter. It was fresh and delicious. The pita was baked fresh for us and was steaming hot out of the oven. The chicken kabobs were juicy and flavorful.  The kibbi was excellent on taste and texture. A definite place I will come back too!

I'll give it a 3 because the servers were attentive, the place was clean and the hummus was really good.  The other food, not so much.  The lentil soup was pretty watery and the beef shwarma had a really odd sweet coating.  I have never tasted any shwarma like that before.  It didn't suit me and I couldn't finish it.  I'm sure it was well prepared, just not prepared in a way that I have ever tasted in any Middle-Eastern/Greek restaurant.  It tasted like something I should get at Teriyaki Madness.  So I won't be back.

If I had known that hummus was a staple in vegetarian diets, I would have quit eating meat years ago! I've been here 3 times in 1 week and my wallet is begging me not to go back!

Each time I've been here I ordered the hummus appetizer.  It comes with 2 fresh baked pita breads so watch out, they're hot!  The hummus is fresh, smooth and creamy.  If you order from the lunch and dinner menu, you can choose to include a smaller side of hummus with your order without ordering the appetizer sized one. Check my photos for a size comparison.  They also give you the option to upgrade the hummus to a spicy version for only a dollar more. Speaking of spicy..

Wow! The habanero hummus is hot! And amazing! I asked whether they used chili oil or flakes and I was told they use fresh peppers. Neat! They also have jalapeño as well as ghost pepper hummus so make sure to try them out.

Each time I've been here I had the shawarma. I've eaten both the chicken and the beef and they were both delicious. The chicken was juicy and flavorful, and the beef was perfectly tender. The fries... oh man, even the fries are amazing! They come with the burgers and sandwiches and they are perfectly fried to a golden yellow crisp. Their home sauce is tasty too! It's probably just mayo and ketchup and something else, but it's the perfect condiment. They give you the option to upgrade to eggplant or zucchini fries as well but I haven't given them a fry. Huehuehue 

My partner had the shrimp scampi and I mistakingly thought it'd come with pasta but it came with rice, lots of rice. The shrimp was great and flavorful too, but next time we'll order the appetizer size without the rice.

Service was great and attentive from both ladies. Actually, each time I've been there I was the only customer there. They say their slow time is between 3-5pm so make sure to drop by then! They also have different pricing for certain lunch and dinner dishes, but I'm not sure what they are since the shawarma is excluded from that. Dinner pricing starts at 3pm too. For the quality of ingredients, flavor, and friendliness, I give this place 5 stars! Give them a try and don't forget to check in!

It's was our first visit. The waitress was very new but nice. I got the mini mezza(mini tapas), the menu said I could choose 6 mini samples of the appetizers or salads but when I went to order it didn't include half of the appetizers(basically no fried cheese or fries). Which was disappointing but I got it anyway. The restaurant was very empty so we didn't have to wait long for our food.  The service was good but the food was just okay.

First time here. 
It was amazing. 
The food was so fresh and great. 
The service was awesome too. Very welcoming. 
Zucchini fries, humus (free with check in), fatoosh(?), and Kafta. 
Awesome

Freaking delicious, all the great reviews brought me here. They were all correct.
Great service
Well seasoned food, made to order and fresh.
I definitely recommend this place to anyone who loves Mediterranean or anyone wanting to try something new. They are very informative too, so don't be afraid to ask questions.

Ya gotta try it!!!

One of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas !! The food is excellent . The beautifully decorated restaurant  provides a clean relaxing atmosphere while enjoying the great food. The staff is super friendly and the Owner comes out from time to time checking on all the tables making sure everyone is satisfied! This is a Must try place if your a local or just visiting, I normally have a very bland pallet and im not always open to trying new foods but im definitely glad ive tried this place otherwise id be missing out!! My favorite off the menu is the factory salad , the kabobs , and the factory burger . Delish!!!
Amazing food and awesome service. Must try this place out!! So good!!!  Hours are great. Place is clean and customer service is awesome.

I'm really love this place. Still gushing just thinking about the delicious food. Check in on yelp for free humus!  Portion is generous and comes with fresh hot pita. 

When I can here it was very empty and it was the smack middle of lunchtime. We looked through the menu and I decided to get the beef schwarma sandwich and upgraded my fries to eggplant fries, and my friend got the combination meat platter. As his side, he choose the salad. The salad was a huge generous portion filled with fresh veggies like tomatoes, bell peppers and Persian cucumbers. So refreshing!  The sauce was delicious as well. 

My eggplant fries were bomb. Crispy but soft in the center. And it came with a decadent dipping sauce... Some sort of spicy aioli....A little goes a long way.  The schwarma sandwich was packed, and I mean packed with thick cuts of quality juicy tender beef. Incredibly flavorful and it was a huge generous portion as well. 

My friend's meat platter came with a variety of their beef selections. Sorry I don't know any of the names. But it was delicious as well. 

I honestly can't wait to come back and try more things!!

3 stars for the service, it was pretty awful! So awful it was funny. We definitely wasn't upset, we were laughing at the fact, but I have to grade appropriately or else I'd be lying. Our server forgot our utensils for half the meal, so we ate non finger food with our hands, received our pita bread at the end of our meal even after asking for it twice, asked if we wanted to order when we didn't even have menus! It was pretty hilarious. We can't fault her too much, she was so sweet. God bless her sweet soul! Again, not upset, just definitely could've used some improvement and you cannot bypass service like that when it's one mistake after another! 

Other than the above, the chicken shawarma plate was a 5 Star across the board! Outstanding flavor that leaves you forking for more. I didn't take my time with it because when it's that good, the end result will be annihilation by mouth hands down! 

Grape leaves were sadly sent back. I have a yearning for dolmadas and these were not making the cut. 

It's called the Hummus Factory, so best believe the hummus was good! You can't have hummus in your name if the hummus isn't good right?! That would just be over reaching! The hummus delivered to its name! 

Most importantly, yes I would come back and yes I would recommend to yelpers everywhere. How does one even fairly rate a place like this! 5 Star food (except the dolmadas) sweet service but awful service at the same time! I feel bad but the yelp is final.

I took my sister here because she LOVES Mediterranean cuisine. We had the offer for free factory hummus and that came out immediately (thank god because we were hungry!) my sister ordered the fatoosh salad which was amazing! So flavorful and a huge portion size. It came out also immediately and we shared with the homemade pita and hummus. It took forever for my Greek burger and eggplant fries to come out. I was already full by the time it arrived and when it was ready it stood in the kitchen for another 10 minutes prior to it being served to me. I would expect next time both entrees to be delivered at the same time as that is the correct way to serve food. All in all, I love this place. The Greek burger was flavor packed with spices and sauces my tongue has never tasted before. The chefs are truly amazing. I would just fix the timing of the food for future reference.

The jalapeño hummus is FABULOUS. The veggies Are fresh and I am loving this place. THE LENTIL SOUP is delicious.  The restaurant is very cool.  Staff is very attentive. Looks like I'm going to be camping out here for a while.  Music not too loud great ambiance 
Looking forward to trying the shawarma and my fav vegetarian stuffed dolmas
Delicious food. Homemade bread. Great service. And open late. The house chicken dish is fantastic!
I always enjoy hummus factory - eggplant fries is a must - my fave, great service ! I have eaten here about 5x now and proud to bring friends here!

Free hummus when you check in. It was a good size serving and very tasty too! The baba ganoush was delicious. I ordered the meat combo plate and everything was very tasty. The service was good too. Very nice and they answered all questions I had. Great place.

By far some of the best and tastiest food I have ever had. Their hummus and fresh pita can't be missed. Their zucchini sticks were a great appetizer, followed by some terrific lentil soup and a fresh Greek salad. Chicken shawarma and the chicken kabobs were beyond tasty, both on a bed of rice. The food was filling yet anything but heavy, most of it was as healthy as it gets. The ambiance and feel of the restaurant was warm and very hospitable and the service made us feel like we were eating dinner at a friend's home. We will be visiting this establishment every time we visit Las Vegas and we usually do so about four times a year. I had no idea what to expect since I had never really eaten Lebanese cuisine and now it is one of my favorites. I highly recommend this fine restaurant with an incredible staff.

Seriously impressed. There must be something with restaurants with the word "factory" because the Cheesecake factory has massive portions and so does this place!!  I ordered the combo kabob dinner and substituted the rice for the eggplant fries upgrade + side of baba ganoush. I can't speak for the other dishes, but the dinner portion came plated in a huge bowl with a very, very generous portion of eggplant fries and 3 wonderfully flavored skewers (I ordered 2 shrimp and 1 chicken). The flavor on the skewers and eggplant fries were delicious - whatever spices they use on the eggplant fries are wonderful! A little sweet, spicy, creamy...heaven!  The pita is also amazing - it's fluffy, served piping hot, and much better than the usual pita that other restaurants serve. Definitely coming back and won't be going back to other places!

Sahara has every average fast food chain, it's awash I. The typical stereotypes- until now!
I first came upon The Hummus Factory at the Foodie Fest when I first moved here two years ago.  Truth be told, I only went for White Castle.  That's correct, White Castle born and raised on it! I'm from Long Island or 'Lawn Gyland' ha!
Now, the first item I tried from The Hummus Factory food truck (yes, in NY these are called 'something else' insert laughing emoji please) was the eggplant fries and instantly became addicted. I then ordered three more orders that day and brought them home. My other favorite is baba Ganosh- it's damn tasty here!
My third favorite- Greek Burger.  
This will now be a weekly stop for me!

I tried a different food for grind tonight other than my usuall food.. Dont know where to start.. The food is FRESH, pls dont believe me pls try it for yourself.. Great Flavor, seasoning n etc.. Cook is perfect, meat is not dry which is A+ in my book.. No warmer food here.. Ive seen the Chef cook his food and make his stuff in the kitchen.. Been longing to try The hummus factory but just when it comes to food it takes me hours to decide what for eat, while driving around, The hummus Factory hit my mind.. Ever since i moved to vegas tried couple places and i just didnt like it is why never did eat middle eastern food but now i have a new spot to eat when i feel like for eat Mediterrain food.. Will comeback for more.. Great Food.., Great Service... Happy Customer...Auuuraiiiiittteeeee \m/ lol
We've been here several times and it is always good! Recommended to a friend for catering a lunch shower - everyone raved. We'll keep coming back.
Just ok, nothing special about a gyro and tge fries were bland. I guess I was expecting a little more.  Sevice was good.
I love the restaurant. The Greek Salad is the best. Staff is cordial. Decore is nice. Service is timely. Thumbs up!

Best hummus and pita bread I have ever had. The falafel was flavorful. The meat was extremely tender and had a delicious sauce and was well stuffed. The chicken schwama was well stuffed also and the chicken was prepared well. The lentil soup was good. 
Next time I come I will order several different hummus and try them all. 
My only complaint is that they do not have a location in Surprise, AZ.

Tried this place after it was recommended and I have to say, the food is delicious! The humans was the best I've had and the entrees were amazing. Trust me and try this place, you will not be disappointed.

I've been wanting to go here for a long time. It's kind of around the corner, down the block kind of place. It's actually in a strip center and generic looking from an outside look. Inside is somewhat casual and friendly enough. The menu is fine and servers were kind and attentive as well. I gave it a 4, because what we ordered was tasty, though the servings to price ratio would make it a bit pricey. It's a Friday and we ordered a platter with different meats which was suppose to include filet mignon, but they ran out. It's Friday for lunch and you ran out of the filet mignon, I'm thinking, what are you going to do for dinner service....not good. I inquired and the server said that they were down to one person, I wasn't sure what that had to do with not having to do with Filet Mignon. I'd probably go back.

I've come here for lunch twice. Both times were excellent! My husband ordered the habanero hummus the last time... it was too hot for me but he loved it!! The Greek salad with gyro meat is my favorite. Honestly everything here has been delicious. We will definitely be back.
Food was not bad for the price. Love the pita bread. Lebanese coffee was not all that great. The place looks very nice inside. Good parking space.
The food is fresh and really good. Definitely will make this a frequent stop. They were kinda slow but service was great.

Best Mediterranean food in Vegas. I've had both the shawarma plate and sandwich. The sandwich comes with fries which can be upgraded to various options. 

Very clean and modern decor. Staff was super friendly and accommodating.  The ambiance is nice enough for a date but not over the top for a casual outing. 

Will have to come back to try some other items off the menu.
Great! Semi-fine dinning full of class and all of the fun! Fantastic service and great for lunch or dinner.

Ok so we went back and tried it several times. The fatoush is consistent but the lubeah not so much. Grape leaves really not good and hummus is not a smooth consistently. The chicken swarma is good. Ethnic restaurants need to be consistent if they want return customers.

This place is great! Love the hummus. 10/10 would return. The kafta is like a Persian koobehdeh which is my favorite item on the menu. Also can't forget the fresh pita that is always being given to you. One of my favorite Mediterranean spots in town!

I have not visited this establishment in person. This review is based on a delivery order.

I don't know my way around Mediterranean cuisine. I'll have some flatbread and hummus for an afternoon snack occasionally, and I'll use feta cheese in a salad or on pizza sometimes. But the last time I had falafel, I think was 11 or 12, and my Hebrew school teacher brought some to our class to try. It was very dry and nearly tasteless.

I ordered the mini Mezza tapas plate. It's six items chosen from a substantial list of appetizers. I thought this was a great way to sample some of the menu without spending a paycheck. They also offer a Mezza plate, and you can choose twelve items from the list, but there's only two of us.

Everything was delicious. Everything (except for the crudités) had a bit of a kick, but not so much that it offended my aging tastebuds. 

I ordered falafel (face my fears, right?), which was very crunchy on the outside, but surprisingly moist and tender on the inside, and what I assume was tzaziki made an excellent dip. I would prefer patties instead of balls, but that's just my thing. 

The stuffed grape leaves were perfectly spiced, and delicious  cold or warmed. 

If you're going out on a date later in the day, do NOT order the hummus! Definitely order it if you're on a date though. You'll both be stinky and happy! There's more garlic in it than in the entire town of Gilford (the worlds garlic capital). If they added even more, it wouldn't bother me; I love garlic. It is pretty powerful though!

The Greek salad was pretty standard: romaine, tomato, feta, and a balsamic vinaigrette dressing. It was very good, and a bit spicy too, but otherwise not particularly remarkable.

The "Mediterranean garlic bread" was a Greek flatbread with melted cheese. It looked very dry and crunchy, but was surprisingly supple.

The crudités were crudités. The carrots could have been a bit more slender.

This was a great sampler, and I'm looking forward to trying some of the full plates on the menu. I can hardly wait to try the different shawarmas and kabobs. 

If you order delivery from GrubHub, there's no minimum and no delivery fee (although you are kinda forced into tipping the driver). Don't hesitate to choose this establishment when ordering delivery!

This restaurant has generated some hype but the food doesn't live up to it. I've been to Lebanon, so nothing can beat the heavenly hummus made in its region of origin. The piping hot bread at H Factory hits the spot but the hummus is just average. The kafta was dry unfortunately, the chicken shawarma lacked authentic spices and was a mess to eat. The zucchini fries were a hit but there is better hummus, sharwarma and koobideh elsewhere in Vegas.

I have to say this place is fantastic; from the service to the food, to the cleanliness of the wonderfully decorated space. 
We ordered the shawarma plates(chicken &I beef) and zucchini fries, two kids pizzas and we Checked in and received a free hummus which was fantastic. 
If you haven't visited this establishment you are missing out. It's a must!! 
This was our first time and we will definitely be back!!

Another bookmark checked off. I came here on a weeknight and found the place to be not too busy. I was going to get my order to go but decided to go ahead and stay.

I ordered the chicken kabob with rice and homemade hummus. I have always heard how great the hummus is here along with the fresh pita bread.

The restaurant is a nice size and there is also seating at the bar so if you don't feel like a table there is always this option. 

I really enjoyed my dinner. The chicken was nice and crispy and the hummus just melted in my mouth. The service was great and I will definitely return here to try more items on the menu.
Fabulous..fresh and delish..spoiled  by Chicago  pita inn..this equals or is even better!  I am now addicted!  Tell your friends..a great new Mediterranean  restaurant with favorite items..yum yum!

The Hummus Factory serves a perfect combination of traditional Mediterranean cuisine and updated fusion dishes.  As the name suggests, hummus is a must try and  I recommend the jalapeño hummus which isn't overpowering with spice and makes a great appetizer to share.  The eggplant fries are amazing and another must try appetizer to share.  Full of flavor and dusted then fried they are ultra tender and highly addicting after first bite.  The zucchini fries are similar if eggplant is not your thing.  As for entrees I highly recommend the chicken kabob dinner portion which comes with rice, veggies and onions.  Large chicken pieces cooked to perfection with lots of flavor highlight this dish.  Be prepared to take food home as the portions are plentiful and ideal for family style dining!  The ambiance and lighting is great for dates and the music selection is very nice.

This place is absolutely phenomenal. I grew up with half my family being Lebanese and this is as good as I can get without going home. The servers are so genuine and quick to help in any way they can. Can't wait to come back.

Very good--almost five star good. I had the falafel sandwich; it was very fresh-tasting--I assume they make their falafel in house. The seasoning on it was tasty. I got an upgrade of fried, lightly breaded zucchini "fries", which were tasty but far too plentiful for me to finish. The service is very friendly.

I've been to this family owned restaurant several times. I've never been disappointed. Some of the best Meditteranian food in town in my opinion. Even if you don't have a lot of time to grab a meal, this place works great. Or have a leisurely dining experience--it's your choice. Give this one a try...you'll love it I'm sure.

Excellent hummus and all the food is fresh and delicious nice to have this food close by kabobs, burgers and salads just perfect.  Enjoy the Lebanon/Greek food meets all the marks.  Try it you will be amazed

Absolutely fantastic! 

Everything about this place was spot on.    The parking was easy and plentiful.  The decor is great.   The service was fantastic.   The food was phenomenal! 

The food is not only good but it's plentiful.   You will either be rolling out of the restaurant or you will have leftovers. 

I would absolutely order the lamb chops.   These were probably the best I've ever had.   

Definitely come here for some good food!

Best Mediterranean food we've had in a long time! They nailed it! Generous portions, great service, amazing flavor. My husband described the pita and babaganoosh as heavenly pillows! My waitress suggested I swap the rice for the fried zucchini with my kabob plate which made for a super tasty meal. We wish we had a Hummus factory in Seattle!

Just came here for dinner with my mom and son. This is the best Mediterranean food I have had by far. Service was excellent, nice new restaurant and very clean, and nice decor. Hummus was very good with the fresh pita bread. We got eggplant fries for an appetizer and they're so good! I got the chicken kabob for dinner, super yummy. I will definitely be back soon! I recommend this to everyone!
Hands down the best gyro in town. The homemade pita is amazing and all of the sauces have different delightful flavors. Try the Turkish coffee!

Ordered take-out the other night and it took me more than expected to go get my order. Was exhausted and no energy or time to cook. 

Lady was super nice on the phone (you, Asian lady!!! So nice!!!) kept calling to see if I was still coming. Got there, she was still very nice and received me even after they had already closed. 

The food was super spicy at some parts, but I was so hungry and so tired, that the fact that I was well treated, the food still got a star!
Great food! Definitely a must for good hummus! Must try the factory burger with cheese, it is to die for! Friendly staff too. Always quick and never packed!

SO yummy!! Thank you to the Yelp community for helping me to find this absolute gem. Located super far from the strip, we were tentative whether or not to actually go. BUT we are so glad we actually did. The portions here are pretty large and the layout is really well done. Staff is very attentive, always making sure that water glasses are filled and customers are happy, and super friendly. 

Recommended: falafel plate, Greek salad, meat combination plate, HUMMUS

NOTE: if you check in, you get a free plate of hummus

Huge fan of this place. The food is absolutely delicious. The gal that waited on us is friendly and so accommodating. It's a bit of a drive for take out for me but well worth the time. Jalapeño hummus is fabulous especially with the warm bread they serve, as well as the stuffed grape
leaves. Highly recommend!!

The service was nice ,a little slow for being on my lunch break. The food was decent  but I was so disappointed my chicken gyro did not have any cucumber on it overall it was ok.  Does not hold a candle to yasou greek on Charleston.
Probably the best hummus in Vegas along with delicious salads and grilled meats. Great choice! Yum

I wished I would have found this place much sooner.  By far the best Mediterranean food in Las Vegas.  I would say the Farej Chicken dinner is the best single entrée you can eat in Las Vegas.  You will experience a euphoric feeling eating it.  Service, Ambiance, Music, Food all top notch.

I feel as if I was transported to the Middle East. This is as authentic as you can get. There was a wonderful  variety of distinct flavors.  My hubby and I split a combo kabab plate and mini mezza. Although it was all so delicious, my favorites were the green beans and baba ganoosh. 
The service was fantastic. The restaurant is beautifully decorated and very clean. Can't wait to come back.
